translated: I have heard, Venerable One, that the Blessed One is dwelling right here in Rājagṛha, in the Bamboo Grove, at the squirrels' feeding ground, together with the Saṅgha of monks and the Saṅgha of bodhisattvas.

analyzed: evam śrutvā upasaṃkramya ekānte nyaṣīdat
translated: Having heard this, he approached and sat down to one side.

analyzed: āvām bhagavataḥ ntike pravrajyām grahīṣyāvaḥ
translated: We will go forth in the presence of the Blessed One.

original: kolita āha / evam āyuṣman pravrajyaivāstu sahāvayoḥ parivāreṇa /
analyzed: kolitaḥ āha evam āyuṣman pravrajyā eva astu saha āvayoḥ parivāreṇa
translated: Kolita said, “Venerable, let it be so. Let us go forth together with our retinues.”

original: upatiṣyakolitau parivrājakau parivārasaṃghena sārdhaṃ yena bhagavān tenopajagmatuḥ /
analyzed: upatiṣyaka ulitau parivrājakau parivāra saṃghena sārdham yena bhagavān tena upajagmatuḥ
translated: Then the wandering mendicants Upatiṣya and Kolita, together with their retinues, went to where the Blessed One was.

original: atha tena kṣaṇalavamuhūrtena māraḥ pāpīyānaśrauṣit /🔽yāvaṅgamagadheṣu janapadeṣu vikhyātayaśaskīrttisamanvāgatau satpuruṣā vupatiṣyakolitau saparivārāvicchataḥ śramaṇasya gautamasya śāsane pravrajyāṃ
analyzed: atha tena kṣaṇa lava muhūrtena māraḥ pāpīyān aśrauṣit  yau aṅga magadheṣu janapadeṣu vikhyāta yaśaḥ kīrtti samanvāgatau sat puruṣāḥ sa parivārau icchataḥ śramaṇasya gautamasya śāsane pravrajyām
translated: At that very moment, the evil Māra heard

analyzed: grahītum
translated: that the two good men Upatiṣya and Kolita, renowned and famous throughout the lands of Aṅga and Magadha, wished to take ordination in the teaching of the ascetic Gautama, together with their retinues.

analyzed: evam śrutvā saḥ cintayat
translated: Having heard this, he thought,

original: Dutt sa cettau śramaṇasya gautamasya śiṣyau bhaviṣyataḥ śūnyaṃ me māraviṣayaṃ kariṣyataḥ /
analyzed: sa ced tau śramaṇasya gautamasya śiṣyau bhaviṣyataḥ śūnyam me māra viṣayam kariṣyataḥ
translated: “If they become disciples of the ascetic Gautama, they will empty my realm of Māra.

analyzed: sāṅkathyataḥ sat puruṣau pravrajyāyāḥ vicchedayeyam
translated: I will create an obstacle for those good men in their going forth.”

analyzed: atha pāpīyān acintayat
translated: Then the evil one thought,

analyzed: veṣa antaram parigṛhya upasaṃkrameyam
translated: “I will go to them in disguise.”

original: atha tena kṣaṇena māraḥ pāpīyān śīghrameva svabhavanādantardhāyāyuṣmato 'śvajito veṣaliṅgena ca pathena tayoḥ satpuruṣayoḥ purataḥ upasaṃkrāntaḥ
analyzed: atha tena kṣaṇena māraḥ pāpīyān śīghram eva sva bhavanāt antardhāya āyuṣmataḥ śvajitaḥ veṣa liṅgena ca pathena tayoḥ sat puruṣayoḥ puratas upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Then, in that very moment, Māra, the evil one, quickly disappeared from his own abode and approached in front of those two good men in the form and appearance of the venerable Aśvajit.

analyzed: upasaṃkramya etat avocat
translated: Having approached, he said this:

original: uktaṃ sarvamidaṃ mayā hi vitathaṃ hetūpamaṃ kāraṇaṃ
analyzed: uktam sarvam idam mayā hi vitatham hetu upamam kāraṇam
translated: All this has been said by me, this false cause, simile, and reason,

analyzed: yuvayoḥ eva manaḥ pracāra niyamam vijñātum evam mayā
translated: in order to know the regulation of the mind's activity of you two alone.

original: sarvaṃ caitadapārthakaṃ hi kathitaṃ nāstyatra hetuḥ punaḥ
analyzed: sarvam ca etat apārthakam hi kathitam na asti atra hetuḥ punar
translated: And all this is indeed purposeless, there is no cause here again,

original: kṛṣṇasyāsya śubhasya karmaṇa iha prāptiḥ phalaṃ vā kutaḥ // / //
analyzed: kṛṣṇasya asya śubhasya karmaṇaḥ iha prāptiḥ phalam vā kutas
translated: where is the attainment or fruit of this black or white action here?

original: kṣipraṃ kāmaguṇeṣvatīva carataṃ kriḍāṃ yuvāṃ vindataṃ
analyzed: kṣipram kāma guṇeṣu atīva caratam kriḍām yuvām vindatam
translated: Quickly engage in the sense pleasures to the highest degree, find delight, you two!

original: mṛtyurnāsti na janma nārtijarase lokaḥ paro nāsti vaḥ /
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ nā asti na janma nā ārti jarase lokaḥ paraḥ nā asti vaḥ
translated: There is no death, no birth, no suffering, old age, or world beyond for you.

original: puṇyāpuṇyaphalaṃ ca karmajanitaṃ nāstyatra hetuḥ kriyā
analyzed: puṇya apuṇya phalam ca karma janitam na asti atra hetuḥ kriyā
translated: And there is no fruit of good or bad action produced by karma, there is no cause here, no action.

original: lābhāya vadatīha śākyatanayo mā śraddhayā gacchatam // / //
analyzed: lābhāya vadati iha śākya tanayaḥ mā śraddhayā gacchatam
translated: The son of the Śākya speaks for the sake of gain here, do not go with faith.

analyzed: atha upatiṣya kolitayoḥ etat abhūt
translated: Then this occurred to Upatiṣya and Kaulita:

analyzed: māraḥ vata ayam pāpīyān upasaṃkrāntaḥ āvayoḥ pravrajyā abhicchedana artham
translated: Surely this is the evil Mara who has come to us in order to disrupt our going forth.

analyzed: atha upatiṣyaḥ parāṅmukhaḥ sva pariṣadam āhūya evam āha
translated: Then Upatiṣya, turning away, addressed his assembly, saying:

analyzed: śṛṇuta yūyam māṇavakāḥ
translated: Listen, you young men!

analyzed: smarata saṃsāra doṣān
translated: Remember the faults of saṃsāra.

analyzed: jarayā pīḍitaḥ lokaḥ mṛtyunā parivāritaḥ
translated: The world is afflicted by old age, surrounded by death.

analyzed: ubhayoḥ tad prahāṇāya pravrajyām sādhu gṛṇhata
translated: For the abandonment of both, it is good to take up the going forth.

analyzed: dutt
translated: Dutt

analyzed: atha kolitaḥ māram provāca
translated: Then Kolita said to Māra:

original: te jñātaḥ pravaraḥ satāṃ matidharo dharmastriduḥkhāntakṛt
analyzed: te jñātaḥ pravaraḥ satām mati dharaḥ dharmaḥ tri duḥkhānta kṛt
translated: You are known, O best of the wise, as the one who upholds the Dharma that ends the three sufferings.

analyzed: kaścid nā asti yadā āvayoḥ matim imām vyuccālayet sarvathā
translated: There is no one who can in any way shake our resolve.

original: tṛṣṇāyāḥ praśamāya dhīramanasā vācāṃ sadā vyutthitau
analyzed: tṛṣṇāyāḥ praśamāya dhīra manasā vācām sadā vyutthitau
translated: With a resolute mind, we are always intent on speaking for the sake of quenching craving.

analyzed: mā siṃha ākṛtinā śṛgāla vacanaiḥ āvām mateḥ bhrāmaya
translated: Do not confuse us with the words of a jackal in the form of a lion.

original: yāśca devatā dṛṣṭasatyāstā gaganasthitāstābhyāṃ satpuruṣābhyaṃ sādhukāraṃ pradaduḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ ca devatāḥ dṛṣṭa satyāḥ tāḥ gagana sthitāḥ tābhyām sat puruṣābhyam sādhukāram pradaduḥ
translated: And the gods who had seen the truth, standing in the sky, gave a shout of applause to those two good men:

original: sādhu sādhu satpuruṣāḥ sarvalokaviśruta eṣa mārgo yaduta pravrajyāniṣkramaḥ /
analyzed: sādhu sādhu sat puruṣāḥ sarva loka viśrutaḥ eṣa mārgaḥ yat uta pravrajyā niṣkramaḥ
translated: Excellent, excellent, O good men! This path, namely going forth and renunciation, is renowned in all the world.

analyzed: sarva duḥkha upaśāntaḥ eṣa mārgaḥ
translated: This path is the cessation of all suffering.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata gocara avatāraḥ eṣa mārgaḥ sarva buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ varṇitaḥ
translated: This path is the domain of all the Tathagatas, and it is praised by all the Blessed Buddhas.

analyzed: praśastaḥ eṣa mārgaḥ
translated: This is the path that is praised.

original: atha khalu māraḥ pāpīyān duḥkhito durmanā vipratisārī tatraivāntarjagāma /
analyzed: atha khalu māraḥ pāpīyān duḥkhitaḥ durmanāḥ vipratisārī tatra eva antar jagāma
translated: Then Mara, the evil one, unhappy, dejected, and remorseful, disappeared right there.

original: atha khalu upatiṣyakolitau parivrājakau svapariṣadamavalokyaitad vacanam ūcatuḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu upatiṣyaka ulitau parivrājakau sva pariṣadam avalokya etat vacanam ūcatuḥ
translated: Then the wandering mendicants Upatiṣya and Kaulita, looking at their own assembly, spoke these words:

original: yat khalu māṇavakā yūyaṃ jānīdhvamāvāṃ jarāmaraṇasāgarapāraṃgamāya tathāgatamuddiśya Dutt 🔽pravrajyāṃ saṃprasthitau /
analyzed: yat khalu māṇavakāḥ yūyam jānīdhvam āvām jarā maraṇa sāgara pāraṃgamāya tathāgatam uddiśya  pravrajyām saṃprasthitau
translated: Listen, young men! We are setting out to go forth in the teaching of the Tathagata in order to reach the other shore of the ocean of old age, sickness, and death.

original: yaḥ punaryuṣmākaṃ necchati bhagavataḥ śāsane pravrajitum ihaiva nivartatām /
analyzed: yaḥ punar yuṣmākam na icchati bhagavataḥ śāsane pravrajitum iha eva nivartatām
translated: If any of you do not wish to go forth in the teaching of the Blessed One, turn back right here.

analyzed: sarvāṇi ca tāni pañca māṇavaka śatāni evam āhuḥ
translated: And all those five hundred young men said:

original: yat kiñcid vayaṃ jānīmastat sarva yuvayoranubhāvena /
analyzed: yat kiñcid vayam jānīmaḥ tat sarva yuvayoḥ anubhāvena
translated: Whatever we know, that is all through your power.

analyzed: nūnam yuvām udāre sthāne pravrajitau
translated: Surely you have gone forth in a lofty place.

original: yam uddiśya pravrajitau yuvāṃ tamuddiśya vayamapi pravrajiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: yam uddiśya pravrajitau yuvām tam uddiśya vayam api pravrajiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We too will go forth in the teaching of the one in whom you have gone forth.

analyzed: atha upatiṣyaka ulitau parivrājakau pañca śata parivārau bhagavantam uddiśya pravrajyāyām
translated: Then, knowing that the wandering mendicants Upatiṣya and Kaulita, with their retinue of five hundred, were setting out for going forth under the Blessed One,

original: saṃprasthitau viditvā māraḥ pāpīyān bahirdeśe rājagṛhasya mahānagarasya mahāprapātamabhinirmitavān
analyzed: saṃprasthitau viditvā māraḥ pāpīyān bahirdeśe rājagṛhasya mahā nagarasya mahā prapātam abhinirmitavān
translated: the evil Māra conjured a great cliff outside the great city of Rājagṛha,

original: yojanaśatānāmadhastāt yathā tau na śakṣyataḥ śramaṇasya gautamasyāntikamupasaṃkramitumiti /
analyzed: yojana śatānām adhastāt yathā tau na śakṣyataḥ śramaṇasya gautamasya antikam upasaṃkramitum iti
translated: a thousand leagues deep, thinking, So that they will not be able to approach the ascetic Gautama.

original: bhagavāṃśca punastādṛśīmṛddhimabhinirmimīte yenatāvupatiṣyakolitau parivrājakau taṃ mahāprapātaṃ na dadarśatuḥ ṛjunā mārgeṇa gacchantau /
analyzed: bhagavān ca punar tādṛśīm ṛddhim abhinirmimīte yenatau upatiṣyaka ulitau parivrājakau tam mahā prapātam na dadarśatuḥ ṛjunā mārgeṇa gacchantau
translated: And the Blessed One again manifested such a miracle that the wandering mendicants Upatiṣya and Kaulita did not see that great cliff, but went along the straight path.

original: punarapi māraḥ pāpīyāṃstayoḥ purataḥ parvatamabhinirmimīte kaṭhinamekaghanamabhedyaṃ
analyzed: punar api māraḥ pāpīyān tayoḥ puratas parvatam abhinirmimīte kaṭhinam eka ghanam abhedyam
translated: Again, the evil Māra conjured a mountain in front of them, solid, compact, and impenetrable,

original: suṣiraṃ yojanasahasramuccaistvena sahasraṃ ca siṃhānāmabhinirmimīte caṇḍānāṃ duṣṭānāṃ ghorāṇām /
analyzed: suṣiram yojana sahasram uccaistvena sahasram ca siṃhānām abhinirmimīte caṇḍānām duṣṭānām ghorāṇām
translated: a thousand leagues high, and conjured a thousand fierce, vicious, and terrible lions.

original: tau ca satpuruṣau bhagavatastejasāpyanubhāvena na ca dadarśatuḥ siṃham /
analyzed: tau ca sat puruṣau bhagavataḥ tejasā api anubhāvena na ca dadarśatuḥ siṃham
translated: But those two good men, by the Blessed One's power and majesty, did not see the lions,

analyzed: na ca siṃhanādam śuśruvatuḥ
translated: and did not hear the lion's roar.

analyzed: ṛjunā ca mārgeṇa yena bhagavān tena upacakramatuḥ
translated: And they approached the Blessed One by the straight path.

original: bhagavāṃścānekaśatasahasrayā pariṣadā parivṛtaḥ puraskṛto dharmaṃ deśayati sma /
analyzed: bhagavān ca aneka śata sahasrayā pariṣadā parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ dharmam deśayati sma
translated: The Blessed One was teaching the Dharma, surrounded and revered by an assembly of many hundreds of thousands.

analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān bhikṣūn āmantrayate sma
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the monks:

original: paśyata yūyaṃ bhikṣavaḥ etau dvau satpuruṣau gaṇapramukhau gaṇaparivārau /🔽anupaśyāmo Dutt
analyzed: paśyata yūyam bhikṣavaḥ etau dvau sat puruṣau gaṇa pramukhau gaṇa parivārau  anupaśyāmaḥ
translated: Monks, do you see these two good men, the leaders and surrounded by their retinues?

analyzed: vayam bhagavan
translated: We see them, Blessed One.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: abhyanujñātau etau dvau satpuruṣau saparivārau mamāntike pravrajiṣyataḥ /
analyzed: abhyanujñātau etau dvau sat puruṣau sa parivārau mama antike pravrajiṣyataḥ
translated: These two good men, with their retinues, have been authorized by me to go forth.

original: pravrajitvā eko mama sarvaśrāvakāṇāṃ prajñāvatāmagre bhaviṣyati dvitīya ṛddhimatām /
analyzed: pravrajitvā ekaḥ mama sarva śrāvakāṇām prajñāvatām agre bhaviṣyati dvitīyaḥ ṛddhimatām
translated: Having gone forth, one will be foremost among all my disciples in wisdom, and the other in miraculous powers.

original: athānyataro bhikṣustasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata /🔽etau ca vijñapuruṣau paricārayantau yau vyākṛto hitakareṇa narottamena /
analyzed: atha anyataraḥ bhikṣuḥ tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata  etau ca vijña puruṣau paricārayantau yau vyākṛtaḥ hita kareṇa nara uttamena
translated: Then a certain monk, at that time, spoke these verses:🔽These two wise men, who were attended to by the Benefactor, the Best of Men,

analyzed: dhī viśāradau upenti iha gauravāt atra etau
translated: Endowed with miraculous powers, confident in wisdom, they have come here out of respect.

original: atha khalu sa bhikṣurutthāyāsanād bahubhirbhikṣubhiḥ sādhaṃ bahubhiśca gṛhasthapravrajitairabhyudgamya tau satpuruṣau paryupāste sma /
analyzed: atha khalu sa bhikṣuḥ utthāya āsanāt bahubhiḥ bhikṣubhiḥ sādham bahubhiḥ ca gṛhastha pravrajitaiḥ abhyudgamya tau sat puruṣau paryupāste sma
translated: Then that bhikṣu rose from his seat, and together with many bhikṣus and many householders and renunciants, he approached and served those two good men.

analyzed: atha tau sat puruṣau yena bhagavān tena upajagmatuḥ
translated: Then those two good men went to where the Blessed One was.

original: upetya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya triḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavataḥ purataḥ sthitvā bhagavantametadūcatuḥ /
analyzed: upetya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya tris pradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavataḥ puratas sthitvā bhagavantam etat ūcatuḥ
translated: Having approached, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One, circumambulated him three times, and stood in front of the Blessed One. They said this to the Blessed One:

original: labhevahi āvāṃ vo bhagavato 'ntike pravrajyāmupasampadāṃ bhikṣubhāvena /
analyzed: labhevahi āvām vaḥ bhagavataḥ ntike pravrajyām upasampadām bhikṣu bhāvena
translated: May we receive the going forth, full ordination, and state of a bhikṣu in the presence of the Blessed One.

analyzed: careva āvām bhagavataḥ ntike brahmacaryam
translated: May we practice the holy life in the presence of the Blessed One.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: kiṃnāmānau yuvām kula putrau
translated: What are your names, young men?

analyzed: upatiṣya āha
translated: Upatiṣya said:

analyzed: tiṣyasya brāhmaṇasya aham putraḥ
translated: I am the son of the brāhmaṇa Tiṣya.

analyzed: mātā me śārikā nāma
translated: My mother's name is Śārikā.

analyzed: tatas me janma
translated: That is where I was born.

original: tena me śāriputra iti nāmadheyaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: tena me śāriputraḥ iti nāmadheyam kṛtam
translated: Therefore, my name is Śāriputra.

analyzed: abhyanujñātaḥ ham pūrvam mātā pitṛbhyām pravrajyāyai
translated: I was previously permitted by my mother and father to go forth.

analyzed: kolitaḥ āha  pitā me kolitaḥ nāma
translated: Kolita said:🔽My father's name is Kolita.

analyzed: mātā me mudgalā nāma
translated: My mother's name is Mudgalā.

original: tena me maudgalyāyana iti sāmānyaṃ nāmadheyaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: tena me maudgalyāyanaḥ iti sāmānyam nāmadheyam kṛtam
translated: Therefore, Maudgalyāyana, I have been given the common name of Maudgalyāyana.

analyzed: kaścid me janaḥ kolitaḥ iti saṃjānāti
translated: Some people know me as Kolita.

analyzed: kaścid maudgalyāyanaḥ iti
translated: Some as Maudgalyāyana.

analyzed: abhyanujñātaḥ ham pūrvam mātā pitṛbhyām pravrajyāyai
translated: I have been permitted by my parents to go forth.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: caratam śāriputra maudgalyāyanau sa parivārau mama antike brahmacaryam iti
translated: Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana, together with your retinues, should practice the holy life in my presence.

analyzed: sā eva anayoḥ pravrajyā upasampadā ca
translated: That itself was their going forth and higher ordination.

analyzed: acira pravrajitau ca śāriputra maudgalyāyanau sa parivārau
translated: Soon after going forth, Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana, together with their retinues,

original: atha māraḥ pāpīyān maheśvararūpeṇa bhagavataḥ purataḥ sthitvaivamāha /
analyzed: atha māraḥ pāpīyān maheśvara rūpeṇa bhagavataḥ puratas sthitvā evam āha
translated: Then the evil Māra, in the form of Maheśvara, stood in front of the Blessed One and said this:

analyzed: ye śāstra artha paricariyāsu nipuṇāḥ vidyāsu pāraṃgatāḥ
translated: Those who are skilled in the service of the meaning of the treatises, who have mastered the sciences,

original: te sarve praṇamanti matsucaraṇau teṣāmahaṃ nāyakaḥ /
analyzed: te sarve praṇamanti mad su caraṇau teṣām aham nāyakaḥ
translated: all of them bow to my good feet. I am their leader.

original: kṣipraṃ maccharaṇaṃ saśiṣyapariṣaṃ gacchāhi bho gautama
analyzed: kṣipram mad śaraṇam sa śiṣya pariṣam gacchāhi bho gautama
translated: Go quickly to my refuge, O Gautama, together with your disciples and retinue.

analyzed: īpsita nirvṛti prāpaṇāya viśadam vakṣyāmi mārgam tava
translated: I will clearly tell you the path for attaining the desired fulfillment.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: tvad mārgaḥ jagataḥ durgati vahaḥ duḥkha arṇava prāpakaḥ
translated: Your path leads this world to bad rebirths, to the ocean of suffering,

original: mārgo me sa carācarasya jagato duḥkhārṇavocchoṣakaḥ /
analyzed: mārgaḥ me sa carācarasya jagataḥ duḥkha arṇava ucchoṣakaḥ
translated: The path that dries up the ocean of suffering for the world, moving and unmoving.

analyzed: kim bhūyas lapasi pragalbha mukharaḥ duṣṭa śṛgāla svaraḥ
translated: What more do you prattle, with a bold and loquacious voice like a wicked jackal?

original: vyābhagno 'si na mārakarma iha me śakto 'si kartuṃ punaḥ // / //🔽Dutt
analyzed: vyābhagnaḥ si na māra karma iha me śaktaḥ si kartum punar  dutt
translated: You are defeated, you cannot do the work of Mara to me again.

original: atha māraḥ pāpīyān maheśvararūpamantardhāya brahmaveṣena punarbhagavantaṃ purataḥ sthitvaivamāha /
analyzed: atha māraḥ pāpīyān maheśvara rūpam antardhāya brahma veṣena punar bhagavantam puratas sthitvā evam āha
translated: Then the evil Mara, having disappeared in the form of Mahesvara, again stood in front of the Blessed One in the guise of Brahma and said this:

analyzed: karma kleśa bhava aṅkura praśamanam yat te kṛtam prajñayā
translated: The cessation of the sprouts of karma and afflictions that you have accomplished through wisdom,

analyzed: duḥkhāni utsahase iha punar yatas sattva artham evam mune
translated: Since you endure suffering here again for the sake of beings, thus, O Sage.

original: nāstyasmin jagati prabho kvacidapi tvatpātrabhūto janaḥ
analyzed: na asti asmin jagati prabho kvacid api tvad pātra bhūtaḥ janaḥ
translated: There is no one in this world, O Lord, who is a suitable recipient for you anywhere.

original: kasmāttvaṃ vigatāmayo na tvaritaṃ nirvāsya kālo hi saḥ // / //
analyzed: kasmāt tvam vigata āmayaḥ na tvaritam nirvāsya kālaḥ hi saḥ
translated: Why do you not quickly attain nirvana, free from disease? For the time has come.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: gaṅgā vāluka sannibha anu sadṛśān sattvān prapaśyāmi aham
translated: I see beings as numerous as the sands of the Ganges,

original: ye vainayikāḥ sthitāḥ karuṇayā te saṃpramocyā mayā /
analyzed: ye vainayikāḥ sthitāḥ karuṇayā te saṃpramocyāḥ mayā
translated: Who are established in discipline out of compassion, they are to be liberated by me.

analyzed: madhya utkṛṣṭa jaghanya tām upagatā nirmokṣa niṣṭhā jagat
translated: The world has reached the limit of liberation, whether middling, excellent, or inferior.

original: nirvāsyāmi tato nimantrayasi māṃ śāṭhyena kiṃ durmate // / //
analyzed: nirvāsyāmi tatas nimantrayasi mām śāṭhyena kim durmate
translated: Why do you invite me with deceit, O evil-minded one?

original: atha punarapi māraḥ pāpīyān duḥkhito durmanā vipratisārī tataścāntardhāya svabhuvanaṃ gatvā śokāgāraṃ praviśya niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: atha punar api māraḥ pāpīyān duḥkhitaḥ durmanāḥ vipratisārī tatas ca antardhāya sva bhuvanam gatvā śokāgāram praviśya niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Then again, Māra the evil one, unhappy, dejected, and remorseful, disappeared from there, went to his own realm, entered his sorrow chamber, and sat down.

original: tatkṣaṇameva ca sarvamārabhuvananivāsinaśca sattvāḥ parasparaṃ pṛcchanti sma /
analyzed: tad kṣaṇam eva ca sarva māra bhuvana nivāsinaḥ ca sattvāḥ parasparam pṛcchanti sma
translated: At that very moment, all the beings dwelling in Māra's realm asked each other:

original: ko heturyadasmākaṃ mahārājaḥ śokāgāraṃ praviśya niṣaṇṇo na ca kaścijjānīte /
analyzed: kaḥ hetuḥ yat asmākam mahā rājaḥ śokāgāram praviśya niṣaṇṇaḥ na ca kaścid jānīte
translated: What is the reason that our great king has entered the sorrow chamber and sat down, and no one knows why?

original: atha pañca mārakanyāśatāni paramaprītikarāṇi puṣpamālyavilepanāni gṛhītvā paramamanojñairvastrābharaṇairalaṃkṛtya
analyzed: atha pañca māra kanyā śatāni parama prīti karāṇi puṣpa mālya vilepanāni gṛhītvā parama manojñaiḥ vastra ābharaṇaiḥ alaṃkṛtya
translated: Then five hundred Māra's daughters, taking extremely pleasing flowers, garlands, and ointments, adorned with extremely pleasing garments and ornaments,

original: paramamanojñaharṣakarāṇi divyāni tūryāṇi pravādayantyaḥ paramamanojñasvareṇa Dutt
analyzed: parama manojña harṣa karāṇi divyāni tūryāṇi pravādayantyaḥ parama manojña svareṇa
translated: playing extremely pleasing and delightful celestial musical instruments, with extremely pleasing voices,

original: nṛtyantyo gāyantyo vādayantyo mahatā divyena pañcāṅgikena tūryeṇa ratikriḍāyuktena mārasya pāpīmataḥ purataḥ sthitāḥ /
analyzed: nṛtyantyaḥ gāyantyaḥ vādayantyaḥ mahatā divyena pañcāṅgikena tūryeṇa rati kriḍā yuktena mārasya pāpīmataḥ puratas sthitāḥ
translated: dancing, singing, and playing, with a great celestial five-part musical ensemble suitable for enjoyment and play, stood before the evil Māra.

original: sa ca māraḥ pāpīyān bāhūn pragṛhya prakośitumārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca māraḥ pāpīyān bāhūn pragṛhya prakośitum ārabdhaḥ
translated: And that wicked Māra, raising his arms, began to cry out:

original: mā śabdaṃ kuruta mā śabdaṃ kuruteti /
analyzed: mā śabdam kuruta mā śabdam kuruta iti
translated: Do not make a sound! Do not make a sound!

analyzed: evam uktāḥ tāḥ punar api pragāyantyaḥ tūryāṇi parājaghnuḥ
translated: Thus addressed, they again sang and beat the musical instruments.

original: māraśca pāpīyān punarapi bāhudvayamutkṣipya prakrośitumārabdho yāvat saptakṛtvaḥ /
analyzed: māraḥ ca pāpīyān punar api bāhu dvayam utkṣipya prakrośitum ārabdhaḥ yāvat sapta kṛtvas
translated: And the wicked Māra, again raising both arms, began to cry out, up to seven times.

original: apsarasastā ratikrīḍāyuktena mārasya pāpīmataḥ purataḥ sthitāstathaiva bahudvayam unnāmyotkrośaṃ cakāra /
analyzed: apsarasaḥ tāḥ rati krīḍā yuktena mārasya pāpīmataḥ puratas sthitāḥ tathā eva bahu dvayam unnāmya utkrośam cakāra
translated: And those celestial nymphs, standing in front of the wicked Māra, engaged in play and enjoyment, raised both arms in the same way and cried out:

original: mā śabdaṃ kurudhvaṃ mā śabdaṃ kurudhvamiti /
analyzed: mā śabdam kurudhvam mā śabdam kurudhvam iti
translated: Do not make a sound! Do not make a sound!

analyzed: evam uktāḥ ca tāḥ apsarasaḥ tūṣṇīm tasthuḥ
translated: Thus addressed, those celestial nymphs remained silent.

original: atha khalu vidyudvalgusvarā nāmāpsarā yena māraḥ pāpīyāṃstenāñjaliṃ praṇamyaivamāha /
analyzed: atha khalu vidyudvalgusvarā nāma apsarāḥ yena māraḥ pāpīyān tena añjalim praṇamya evam āha
translated: Then a celestial nymph named Lightning-Sweet-Sound, bowing with folded hands to the wicked Māra, said this:

original: kiṃ te vibho cyutinimittamihādya dṛṣṭaṃ kiṃ vā jagaddhutavahākulamadya jātam /
analyzed: kim te vibho cyuti nimittam iha adya dṛṣṭam kim vā jagat hutavaha ākulam adya jātam
translated: What sign of your fall have you seen here today, lord? Or has the world become agitated by forest fires today?

original: śatrustavādhikabalaḥ kimihāsti kaścit kiṃ vā na nandasi samāśrayase ca śokam // / //
analyzed: śatruḥ tava adhika balaḥ kim iha asti kaścid kim vā na nandasi samāśrayase ca śokam
translated: Is there some enemy here with greater power than you? Why are you not delighted and resort to sorrow?...

analyzed: dutt
translated: Dutt

analyzed: māraḥ prāha
translated: Māra said:

original: śatrurmamāsti balavān nigṛhītacetā māyāsuśikṣita bhuvi nara śākyaputraḥ /
analyzed: śatruḥ mama asti balavān nigṛhīta cetāḥ māyā su śikṣita bhuvi nara śākya putraḥ
translated: I have a powerful enemy, his mind controlled, well-trained in magic on earth, a man, a son of the Śākyas.

original: tallakṣaṇaṃ yadi na hasti ca kaścidevaṃ śūnyaṃ kariṣya ti mamaiṣa sa kāmadhātum // / //
analyzed: tad lakṣaṇam yadi na ca kaścid evam śūnyam mama eṣa sa kāmadhātum
translated: If his characteristics are not like this, then someone will empty my realm of desire.

analyzed: sā apsarāḥ provāca
translated: That celestial maiden spoke:

original: svāminnupāyabalavīryaparākramaiḥ kaḥ kartuṃ kṣayaṃ paramamīśa ihādya tasya /
analyzed: svāmin upāya bala vīrya parākramaiḥ kaḥ kartum kṣayam paramam īśaḥ iha adya tasya
translated: O Lord, who by the power of means, strength, and valor can destroy him today, the supreme one here?

original: kaḥ śaknuyāt tribhavabandhanadīrghatīraṃ tṛṣṇārṇavaṃ kṣapayituṃ balaśaktiyuktaḥ // / //🔽Dutt
analyzed: kaḥ śaknuyāt tri bhava bandhana dīrgha tīram tṛṣṇā arṇavam kṣapayitum bala śakti yuktaḥ  dutt
translated: Who, endowed with strength and power, can dry up the ocean of craving, the long shore of the bondage of the three existences?

analyzed: māraḥ prāha
translated: The Buddha replied:
The noose of generosity, vows, intention, compassion, and aspiration, holding the supreme weapon of emptiness and signlessness,
The one who teaches the cessation of existence without remainder, favorable to the pacification of the path of deliverance from saṃsāra.

original: śūnyeṣu grāmanagareṣu vanāntareṣu girikandareṣvapi ca santi tasya śiṣyāḥ /
analyzed: śūnyeṣu grāma nagareṣu vana antareṣu giri kandareṣu api ca santi tasya śiṣyāḥ
translated: His disciples are in empty villages, towns, forests, and mountain caves.

original: dhyānābhiyuktamanasaḥ praviviktacārāḥ doṣakṣayāya satataṃ vidhivat prayuktāḥ // / //
analyzed: dhyāna abhiyukta manasaḥ pravivikta cārāḥ doṣa kṣayāya satatam vidhivat prayuktāḥ
translated: Their minds are devoted to meditation, their conduct is secluded, and they are constantly engaged in the proper methods for destroying faults.

original: ṛddhyāḥ balaiḥ karuṇayā ca sahāyavantau upatiṣyakaulita ubhau muninā vinītau /
analyzed: ṛddhyāḥ balaiḥ karuṇayā ca sahāyavantau upatiṣyakaulita ubhau muninā vinītau
translated: The two, Upatiṣya and Kaulita, who are endowed with the power of miracles, strength, and compassion, have been disciplined by the Sage.

original: trailokyasarvavidhinā suvinītadharmā śūnyaṃ kariṣyati ca me kila kāmadhātum // / //
analyzed: trailokya sarva vidhinā su vinīta dharmā śūnyam kariṣyati ca me kila kāmadhātum
translated: He, who is well-disciplined in the rites of the three worlds and in the Dharma, will surely empty my realm of desire.

original: atha taiḥ pañcabhirmārakanyāśatairmārasya pāpīmato 'ntikād bhagavato guṇavarṇaṃ śrutvā sarvairākāravigatavidyunnāma bodhisattvasamādhiḥ pratilabdhā
analyzed: atha taiḥ pañcabhiḥ māra kanyā śataiḥ mārasya pāpīmataḥ ntikāt bhagavataḥ guṇa varṇam śrutvā sarvaiḥ ākāravigatavidyut nāma bodhisattva samādhiḥ pratilabdhā
translated: Then, those five hundred daughters of Māra, having heard from the wicked Māra the praise of the Blessed One's qualities, all attained the bodhisattva samādhi called Formless Lightning.

original: atha tāni pañca mārakanyāśatāni divyāni tūryāṇi tāni ca divyāpuṣpagandhamālyavilepanābharaṇavibhūṣaṇīkarāṇi yena bhagavāṃstenākṣipan bhagavataḥ 🔽samīpe /
analyzed: atha tāni pañca māra kanyā śatāni divyāni tūryāṇi tāni ca divyā puṣpa gandha mālya vilepana ābharaṇa vibhūṣaṇīkarāṇi yena bhagavān tena ākṣipan bhagavataḥ  samīpe
translated: Then, those five hundred daughters of Māra threw those divine musical instruments and those divine flowers, perfumes, garlands, ointments, adornments, and ornaments towards the Blessed One.

analyzed: tāni ca divyāni
translated: They rained down near the Blessed One.

original: puṣpāṇi tāni ca divyāni tūryāṇi te ca yāvadalaṃkārā bhagavato 'nubhāvena veṇuvane vavarṣuḥ /🔽tāśca mārakanyāḥ svayamadrākṣuḥ saparivāram /
analyzed: puṣpāṇi tāni ca divyāni tūryāṇi te ca yāvat alaṃkārāḥ bhagavataḥ nubhāvena veṇu vane vavarṣuḥ  tāḥ ca māra kanyāḥ svayam adrākṣuḥ sa parivāram
translated: And those divine flowers, those divine musical instruments, and those ornaments rained down through the Blessed One's power in the Bamboo Grove.🔽And those daughters of Māra saw themselves and their retinue.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punaḥ svayameva prasādajātā babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar svayam eva prasāda jātāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: And having seen, they themselves became filled with faith.

original: yena veṇuvane evaṃrūpaṃ puṣpavarṣaṃ pravṛṣṭamiti te ca bhikṣavaḥ saṃśayajātā bhagavantaṃ papracchuḥ /🔽yadbhagavannūnaṃ śāriputramaudgalyāyanayoḥ saparivārayoridam evaṃrūpaṃ mahāścaryādbhutādṛṣṭāśrutapūrvaṃ varṣaṃ pravṛṣṭām /🔽ko nvatra bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ /
analyzed: yena veṇu vane evaṃrūpam puṣpa varṣam pravṛṣṭam iti te ca bhikṣavaḥ saṃśaya jātāḥ bhagavantam papracchuḥ  yat bhagavan ūnam śāriputra maudgalyāyanayoḥ sa parivārayoḥ idam evaṃrūpam mahā āścarya adbhuta adṛṣṭa aśruta pūrvam varṣam pravṛṣṭām  kaḥ nu atra bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ
translated: The monks, having seen this, were amazed and asked the Blessed One, Blessed One, what is the cause, what is the condition, that such a great and wonderful rain of flowers has fallen in the Bamboo Grove?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said, This is not the power of Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana, but rather of the evil one.

original: nāyaṃ kulaputrayoranubhāvaḥ hanta pāpīmataḥ pañcamātraiḥ paricārikāśataistato mārabhavanādidamevaṃrūpaṃ mahāpuṣpavarṣaṃ yāvadalaṅkāravarṣamutsṛṣṭaṃ
analyzed: na ayam kula putrayoḥ anubhāvaḥ hanta pāpīm atas pañca mātraiḥ paricārikā śataiḥ tatas māra bhavanāt idam evaṃrūpam mahā puṣpa varṣam yāvat alaṅkāra varṣam utsṛṣṭam
translated: Indeed, from the palace of Māra, by five hundred of his female attendants, this great rain of flowers, up to this rain of ornaments, has been released

analyzed: mama pūjā karmaṇe
translated: in order to worship me.

analyzed: cira mā etāḥ me anukūlāḥ
translated: They have been favorable to me for a long time.

analyzed: tāḥ mama antikāt vyākaraṇam pratilapsyante nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: They will receive a prophecy from me of the highest complete enlightenment.

original: atha tāni pañcamātrāṇi mārakanyāśatāni svayameva bhagavataḥ śrutaghoṣavyāhāramabhiśṛṇvanti /
analyzed: atha tāni pañca mātrāṇi māra kanyā śatāni svayam eva bhagavataḥ śruta ghoṣa vyāhāram abhiśṛṇvanti
translated: Then those five hundred daughters of Māra, hearing with their own ears the Blessed One's voice,

original: etāśca bhagavanto 'ntike prasādajātāstena prasādaprāmodyena bodhicittam asaṃpramoṣaṃ nāma samādhiṃ pratilebhire /
analyzed: etāḥ ca bhagavantaḥ ntike prasāda jātāḥ tena prasāda prāmodyena bodhi cittam asaṃpramoṣam nāma samādhim pratilebhire
translated: And those Blessed Ones, having generated faith in the Blessed One, through that faith and joy, attained a samadhi called not forgetting the mind of enlightenment.🔽Then those Mara daughters, in that very Bamboo Grove, covering one shoulder with their robes,

original: atha khalu tā mārakanyāḥ tatraiva veṇuvane ekāṃsaṃ cīvaraṃ prāvṛtya dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu tāḥ māra kanyāḥ tatra eva veṇuvane eka aṃsam cīvaram prāvṛtya dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam
translated: placing their right knees on the ground,

original: pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpyāñjaliṃ kṛtvā yasyāṃ diśi bhagavān viharati tāṃ diśaṃ nirīkṣamāṇā evamūcuḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya añjalim kṛtvā yasyām diśi bhagavān viharati tām diśam nirīkṣamāṇāḥ evam ūcuḥ
translated: gazing in the direction where the Blessed One was, said this:

original: tṛṣṇā nadī nikhilaśoṣakasarvalokam ālokya netravikalaṃ jagadekacakṣuḥ /🔽Dutt
analyzed: tṛṣṇā nadī nikhila śoṣaka sarva lokam ālokya netra vikalam jagadekacakṣuḥ  dutt
translated: Seeing the river of craving, which dries up all the world, and the world without eyes, the sole eye of the world,🔽you are the star of this world with its gods and men.

original: tvaṃ tārako 'sya jagataḥ sanarāmarasya buddhā vayaṃ kathamihāśu mune bhavema // / //
analyzed: tvam tārakaḥ sya jagataḥ sa nara amarasya buddhāḥ vayam katham iha āśu mune bhavema
translated: O Sage, how quickly may we become Buddhas here?

original: naradevapūjya bhagavan paramārthavādin strītvaṃ jugupsitamapāsya vayaṃ samagram /
analyzed: naradeva pūjya bhagavan parama artha vādin strī tvam jugupsitam apāsya vayam samagram
translated: O Blessed One, worshipped by men and gods, speaker of the ultimate truth, having abandoned this despised female state, we together

original: ṛddhyā tavottamagatiṃ tvaritaṃ labhema gatvā munīndravacanaṃ śṛṇuyāma evam // / //
analyzed: ṛddhyā tava uttama gatim tvaritam labhema gatvā muni indra vacanam śṛṇuyāma evam
translated: may quickly attain the highest state through your power. Having gone there, may we hear the words of the Lord of Sages in this way.

analyzed: nairātmya vādi bhagavan parama artha darśin bodhyaṅga ratna dara nirmala vāc pradīpa
translated: O Blessed One, speaker of non-self, seer of the ultimate truth, jewel of the factors of enlightenment, lamp of the stainless speech,

original: ākṛṣya mārabalamapratima tvamasyodbodhāya śīghramadhunā mama vyākuruṣva // / //
analyzed: ākṛṣya māra balam apratima tvam asya udbodhāya śīghram adhunā mama vyākuruṣva
translated: Having drawn forth the incomparable power of Māra, you should quickly awaken me now and proclaim it.

original: atha khalu mārakanyā utthāyāsanādekakaṇṭhena māraṃ pāpī mantametadūcuḥ /🔽tvaṃ nāma duṣkṛtamatibhagavatsakāśe duṣṭaḥ kathaṃ śriyamavāpya calāmasārām /
analyzed: atha khalu māra kanyāḥ utthāya āsanāt eka kaṇṭhena māram pāpī mantam etat ūcuḥ  tvam nāma duṣkṛta mati bhagavat sakāśe duṣṭaḥ katham śriyam avāpya calām asārām
translated: Then the daughters of Māra rose from their seats and with one voice said this to Māra, the evil one:🔽You, with a wicked mind, are evil in the presence of the Blessed One. How, having attained unstable and worthless glory,

analyzed: jāti ādi duḥkha samupadruta sarva mūrtim ghorām daśām upagataḥ si mada avaliptaḥ
translated: have you, intoxicated with pride, come to a terrible state, with your entire body afflicted by the suffering of birth and so forth?

original: śraddhāṃ jine kuru tathā vyapanīya roṣaṃ saṃsāradoṣamadapaṅkasamuddhṛtātmā /🔽eṣo 'stu te vidita sarvajagasvabhāvaḥ āgaccha kāruṇikamāśugatiṃ prayāmaḥ // / //
analyzed: śraddhām jine kuru tathā vyapanīya roṣam saṃsāra doṣa mada paṅka samuddhṛta ātmā  eṣa u stu te vidita sarva jaga svabhāvaḥ āgaccha kāruṇikam āśu gatim prayāmaḥ
translated: Have faith in the Victor, and thus cast aside anger. With your mind lifted out of the mud of the faults and pride of cyclic existence,

analyzed: dutt
translated: may you know this nature of the entire world. Come, let us quickly go to the compassionate one who has the swift gait.

original: atha khalu mārasya pāpīmataḥ paramaduṣṭamanasaḥ etadabhūt /
analyzed: atha khalu mārasya pāpīmataḥ parama duṣṭa manasaḥ etat abhūt
translated: Then indeed, the evil Māra, with a supremely wicked mind, had this thought:

original: yattvahaṃ tādṛśaṃ mārabalaviṣayavegaṃ samanusmareyaṃ yadetāni pañca paricārikāśatāni pañcapāśabandhanavaddhamātmānaṃ saṃpaśyeyuryathehaiva
analyzed: yat tu aham tādṛśam māra bala viṣaya vegam samanusmareyam yat etāni pañca paricārikā śatāni pañca pāśa bandhana vaddham ātmānam saṃpaśyeyuḥ yathā iha eva
translated: Let me recall the power and force of Māra's domain such that these five hundred attendants will see themselves bound by the five fetters, and thus

analyzed: nivṛtya vane na punar gantum śaknuyuḥ
translated: they will not be able to return to the forest and go again.

analyzed: māraḥ tāḥ ca bandhum na śaktaḥ
translated: Māra will not be able to bind them.

analyzed: tat kutas
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: tathā hi tāni pañca paricārikā śatāni tathāgata adhiṣṭhānāni
translated: Because those five hundred attendants are empowered by the Tathāgata.

original: atha khalu tāni pañca paricārikā śatāni mārasya pāpīmato 'ntikāt pracakramuḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu tāni pañca paricārikā śatāni mārasya pāpīmataḥ ntikāt pracakramuḥ
translated: Then those five hundred attendants set out from the presence of the evil Māra.

original: atha mārasya pāpīmataḥ duṣṭasyaitadabhavat /🔽yattvahaṃ punarapi tādṛśaṃ mārabalaviṣayavegaṃ samanusmareyaṃ yat sarvamidam ākaśavairambhyasaṃghātairmahākālameghairmahākālavāyu
analyzed: atha mārasya pāpīmataḥ duṣṭasya etat abhavat  yat tu aham punar api tādṛśam māra bala viṣaya vegam samanusmareyam yat sarvam idam ākaśa vairambhya saṃghātaiḥ mahākāla meghaiḥ mahākāla vāyu
translated: Then the evil Māra thought this:

original: bhiḥ āvṛtaṃ yathā tā eva paricārikāḥ sarvā digvidikṣu saṃbhrāntāḥ śramaṇagautamaṃ na paśyeyuḥ /
analyzed: bhiḥ āvṛtam yathā tāḥ eva paricārikāḥ sarvāḥ diś vidikṣu saṃbhrāntāḥ śramaṇa gautamam na paśyeyuḥ
translated: If I were to recollect again the power and range of Māra's army, by which this entire space is filled with great dark clouds and great dark winds, as those very attendants, confused in all directions, would not see the ascetic Gautama,

analyzed: punar eva me bhavanam āgaccheyuḥ
translated: they would return to my abode again.

original: tathāpi buddhādhiṣṭhānabalena kiyantamapi vāyuṃ na śaknotyutpādayituṃ yo 'ntato bālāgramapi kampayet prāgeva bahutaram /
analyzed: tathā api buddha adhiṣṭhāna balena kiyantam api vāyum na śaknoti utpādayitum yaḥ bālāgram api kampayet prāk eva bahutaram
translated: Nevertheless, by the power of the Buddha's empowerment, he is not able to produce even a little wind that would move even the tip of a hair, let alone much more.

original: atha māraḥ pāpīmān bhūyasyā mātrayā duṣṭo duḥkhito durmanā vipratisārī uccaiḥsvareṇa svaputragaṇapāriṣadyān vyākrośat /🔽sarvaṃ mārabhavanaṃ śabdena pūrayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha māraḥ pāpīmān bhūyasyā mātrayā duṣṭaḥ duḥkhitaḥ durmanāḥ vipratisārī uccais svareṇa sva putra gaṇa pāriṣadyān vyākrośat  sarvam māra bhavanam śabdena pūrayāmāsa
translated: Then the evil Māra, even more wicked, miserable, dejected, and remorseful, cried out in a loud voice to his own retinue of sons and followers:

original: āgacchata priyasutā gaṇapāriṣadyā bhraṣṭā vayaṃ svaviṣayāt svabālācca ṛddheḥ /🔽Dutt
analyzed: āgacchata priya sutāḥ gaṇa pāriṣadyāḥ bhraṣṭāḥ vayam sva viṣayāt sva bālāt ca ṛddheḥ  dutt
translated: Come, dear sons and followers! We have been deprived of our domain and our own magical power!

original: jāto 'tra eṣa viṣavṛkṣa ivāntarāt sa māyāśaṭho madhuravādī sa śākyaputraḥ // / //
analyzed: eṣa viṣa vṛkṣaḥ iva antarāt sa māyā śaṭhaḥ madhura vādī sa śākyaputraḥ
translated: This one has been born here, like a poisonous tree from within, that deceitful and cunning son of the Śākyas, who speaks sweetly.

original: atha tena śabdena sarvāstā mārakanyā māraduhitaraśca sarve ca māraputrā gaṇapārṣadyā dūrataḥ ṛtamānarūpāḥ śīghramupagamya pāpīmataḥ puratastasthuḥ
analyzed: atha tena śabdena sarvāḥ tāḥ māra kanyāḥ māra duhitaraḥ ca sarve ca māra putrāḥ gaṇa pārṣadyāḥ dūratas ṛta māna rūpāḥ śīghram upagamya pāpīmataḥ puratas tasthuḥ
translated: Then, by that sound, all those daughters of Māra, all those sons of Māra, the followers and retinue, quickly approached from afar with a respectful appearance and stood in front of the evil one.

original: tasyāṃ ca pariṣadi jayamatirnāma māra putraḥ sa prāñjalirbhūtvaivamāha /
analyzed: tasyām ca pariṣadi jayamatiḥ nāma māra putraḥ sa prāñjaliḥ bhūtvā evam āha
translated: And in that assembly, a son of Māra named Jayamati, with palms joined, said this:

original: kiṃ durmanāḥ paramakopaviduṣṭacetā no kalpadāha iha na cyutirasti te 'smāt /
analyzed: kim durmanāḥ parama kopa viduṣṭa cetāḥ no kalpa dāhaḥ iha na cyutiḥ asti te smāt
translated: Why are you so dejected, with a mind extremely angry and wicked? There is no conflagration here, nor is there your fall from this place.

original: śatrurna cāsti tava kaścidiha pravṛddho mohaṃ gato 'si kimutānyamatirakasmāt // / //
analyzed: śatruḥ na ca asti tava kaścid iha pravṛddhaḥ moham gataḥ si kim uta anya matiḥ akasmāt
translated: You have no powerful enemy here at all. Why are you so confused, let alone about something else suddenly?

analyzed: māraḥ prāha
translated: Mara said:

original: na tvaṃ paśyasi śākyaputra vṛṣalaṃ yat sanniṣaṇṇaṃ
analyzed: na tvam paśyasi śākyaputra vṛṣalam yat sanniṣaṇṇam
translated: You do not see, son of the Shakyas, the outcaste who is sitting

original: drume yadvākyaṃ vadasīha nāsti balavān śatrustavetyagrataḥ /🔽sarve tena śaṭhena caikabalinā saṃbhrāmitā naikaśo
analyzed: drume yat vākyam vadasi iha nā asti balavān śatruḥ tava iti agratas  sarve tena śaṭhena ca eka balinā saṃbhrāmitāḥ na ekaśas
translated: under the tree, whom you say here in front of me that you have no powerful enemy.🔽All of us, along with our sons, retinues, and followers, have been deceived many times

analyzed: vayam sa suta pārṣada
translated: by that single powerful deceitful one.

analyzed: ye pi asmin jagati pradhāna puruṣāḥ vikhyāta kīrti śriyaḥ
translated: Those who in this world are the foremost men, renowned for their fame and glory,

analyzed: vidvāṃsaḥ bahu śāsra kāvya racanā vyagrāḥ samagrāḥ drutam
translated: learned, fully occupied in composing many scriptures and poems, quickly

analyzed: ye tam śākya sutam gata adhi śaraṇam dharma aṅkuśaiḥ tāḍitāḥ
translated: those who have gone to that son of the Shakyas for refuge and are struck by the goad of Dharma,

analyzed: dutt
translated: Dutt

original: sa tveṣa priyavigrahaḥ śaṭhamatiḥ śatrurmayā yudyate // / //
analyzed: sa tu eṣa priya vigrahaḥ śaṭha matiḥ śatruḥ mayā yudyate
translated: that very one, with a pleasing form, deceitful in mind, is my enemy, whom I fight.

original: etā vai paricārikāḥ priyatamāḥ protsṛjya māṃ niṣkṛpāḥ
analyzed: etāḥ vai paricārikāḥ priyatamāḥ protsṛjya mām niṣkṛpāḥ
translated: These very beloved attendants, having abandoned me without compassion,

original: tūrṇataṃ śramaṇaṃ gatādya śaraṇaṃ hitvā hi me rājyakam /
analyzed: tūrṇatam śramaṇam gatā adya śaraṇam hitvā hi me rājyakam
translated: have quickly gone for refuge to the ascetic today, having abandoned my kingdom.

original: kartā kṛtsnamidaṃ bhavatrayamataḥ śūnyaṃ śaṭho māyayā
analyzed: kartā kṛtsnam idam bhava trayam atas śūnyam śaṭhaḥ māyayā
translated: Therefore, that deceitful one will make this entire triple world empty by his magic.

analyzed: bhasmīkurmaḥ iha adya yadi ati balena āśu prayatnāt vayam
translated: If we can quickly reduce him to ashes with our great strength and effort today, that would be good.

original: atha te sarve māraputrāḥ sapārṣadyāḥ prāñjalayaḥ etadūcuḥ /
analyzed: atha te sarve māra putrāḥ sa pārṣadyāḥ prāñjalayaḥ etat ūcuḥ
translated: Then all those sons of Māra, together with their retinues, with palms joined, said this:

analyzed: evam astu yat asmākam ṛddhi bala viṣa anubhāva vikurvitam sarvam darśayisyāmaḥ
translated: Let it be so. We will show all our magical power, strength, and splendor.

original: yadi śaknumaḥ etaṃ śākyaputraṃ bhasmīkartumityevaṃ kuśalam /
analyzed: yadi śaknumaḥ etam śākyaputram bhasmīkartum iti evam kuśalam
translated: If we can reduce this son of the Śākyas to ashes, that would be good.

original: yadi na śaknumaḥ tasya śaraṇaṃ gamiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: yadi na śaknumaḥ tasya śaraṇam gamiṣyāmaḥ
translated: If we cannot, we will go for refuge to him.

analyzed: svayam eva pitar tvam pratyakṣaḥ si
translated: Father, you yourself are a witness.

original: yad vayaṃ mahāsainyaparivṛtāḥ prāgeva ekākinā advitīyena anena śākyaputreṇādhikabalena parājitāḥ kiṃ punaretarhyanekaparicārikā dṛṣṭivivhalāḥ
analyzed: yat vayam mahā sainya parivṛtāḥ prāk eva ekākinā advitīyena anena śākyaputreṇa adhika balena parājitāḥ kim punar etarhi aneka paricārikāḥ dṛṣṭi vivhalāḥ
translated: When we were surrounded by a great army, we were already defeated by this son of the Śākyas, who was alone, without a second, and of greater strength. How much more so now, with many attendants, our vision clouded?

analyzed: māraḥ pāpīyān evam āha
translated: The evil Māra said this:

original: gacchata tāvad bhadramukhāḥ /🔽yadi śaknuta evanaṃ śramaṇagautamaṃ ghātayituṃ punarāgacchata /
analyzed: gacchata tāvat bhadra mukhāḥ  yadi śaknute evanam śramaṇa gautamam ghātayitum punar āgacchata
translated: Go for now, good sirs.🔽If you can kill that monk Gautama, then come back.

analyzed: atha na śaktāḥ tathā api āgacchata
translated: But if you cannot, then come back anyway.

analyzed: sva bhavanam vayam pālayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will protect our own abode.

original: atha māraparṣaddvādaśabimbarāṇi tato 'tikramya ita ūrdhvaṃyāvaccaturaśītiṃ yojanasahasrāṇi sphuritvā tādṛśaṃ mārabalaṛddhivegaṃ Dutt
analyzed: atha māra parṣad dvādaśa bimbarāṇi tikramyaḥ itas ūrdhvam yāvat caturaśītim yojana sahasrāṇi sphuritvā tādṛśam māra bala ṛddhi vegam
translated: Then the twelve koṭis of Māra’s army, surpassing that, up to eighty-four thousand yojanas, having shaken, displayed such a Māra-power, strength, and speed,

analyzed: darśayāmāsuḥ
translated: and showed it.

analyzed: sarvam caturdvīpikāyām ākāśam mahākāla meghaiḥ āpūrayāmāsuḥ
translated: And they filled the entire sky of the four continents with great dark clouds.

original: mahākālavāyubhiśca ulkāpātaiśca sumeruṃ parvatarājānaṃ pāṇibhiḥ parājaghnuḥ /
analyzed: mahākāla vāyubhiḥ ca ulkā pātaiḥ ca sumerum parvata rājānam pāṇibhiḥ parājaghnuḥ
translated: And with great dark winds and meteors, they struck Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, with their hands.

analyzed: sarvam cāturdvīpam prakampayāmāsuḥ
translated: And they made the entire four continents tremble.

analyzed: parama bhairavān ca śabdān samutsasarjuḥ
translated: And they let loose extremely terrifying sounds.

original: yato nāgā mahānāgā yato yakṣā mahāyakṣāḥ sarvāvantyā mahāpṛthivyā sagiriśailaparvatāyāḥ
analyzed: yatas nāgāḥ mahā nāgāḥ yatas yakṣāḥ mahā yakṣāḥ sarva avantyāḥ mahā pṛthivyā sa giri śaila parvatāyāḥ
translated: From which nāgas, great nāgas, from which yakṣas, great yakṣas, from the entire great earth with its mountains, rocks, and hills,

original: sumeruśca parvatarājaḥ kampaṃ viditvā sarasāṃ mahāsarasāṃ nadīkunadīmahānadīnāṃ mahāsamudrāṇāñca
analyzed: sumeruḥ ca parvata rājaḥ kampam viditvā sarasām mahā sarasām nadī kunadī mahā nadīnām mahā samudrāṇām ca
translated: and Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, having known the trembling, of the lakes, great lakes, rivers, small rivers, great rivers, and great oceans,

analyzed: saṃkṣobham jñātvā gagana tale tasthuḥ
translated: having known the agitation, stood in the sky.

original: sā ca māraparṣat sumerumavanīṃ sthitvā yojanapramāṇāṃ vṛṣṭim abhinirmīya aṅgamagadheṣu samutsasarjuḥ /
analyzed: sā ca māra parṣad sumerum avanīm sthitvā yojana pramāṇām vṛṣṭim abhinirmīya aṅga magadheṣu samutsasarjuḥ
translated: And that assembly of Māra, having stood on the ground of Mount Sumeru, having created a rain one yojana in size, let it loose on Aṅga and Magadha.

analyzed: mahāntam ca asya musala pāśa tomara bhiṇḍipāla nārāca kṣura prakṣura mukha kṣura nārāca kṣura prakṣura mukha kṣura vāsi kṣura danta mukha kṣura danta karāla vajra vāsi kṣura danta mukha kṣura danta karāla vaktra vikarāla vaktra dṛḍha khara paruṣa rūkṣa varṣam  nirmāya utsasarjuḥ
translated: They created a great rain of clubs, nooses, spears, javelins, iron arrows, razor arrows, razor-faced arrows, razor-like iron arrows, razor-faced arrows, razor-like iron teeth, razor-faced arrows with terrible iron teeth, and terrible-faced arrows with iron teeth, and let it loose.

original: atha bhagavān tasmin samaye māramaṇḍalavidhvaṃsanaṃ nāma samādhiṃ samāpede /
analyzed: atha bhagavān tasmin samaye māra maṇḍala vidhvaṃsanam nāma samādhim samāpede
translated: Then the Blessed One, at that time, entered the concentration called Destroying the Circle of Mara.

analyzed: yena sarvām śilā praharaṇa vṛṣṭim divya utpala padma kumuda puṇḍarīka māndārava mahāmāndārava puṣpa vṛṣṭim adhitiṣṭhat
translated: By which he blessed the entire hail-weapon rain to be a rain of divine blue lotus, lotus, white water lily, white lotus, coral tree, and great coral tree flowers.

analyzed: tān ca śabdān nānā vādyān adhyatiṣṭhat
translated: And he blessed those sounds to be the sounds of various musical instruments.

original: yaduta dharmaśabdaṃ buddhaśabdaṃ saṃghaśabdaṃ pāramitāśabdam abhijñāśabdaṃ bodhimaṇḍopasaṃkramaṇaśabdaṃ yāvatsopādānanirupādānaśabdā nadhyatiṣṭhat
analyzed: yat uta dharma śabdam buddha śabdam saṃgha śabdam pāramitā śabdam abhijñā śabdam bodhimaṇḍa upasaṃkramaṇa śabdam yāvat sa upādāna nirupādāna śabdāḥ na adhyatiṣṭhat
translated: Namely, the sound of Dharma, the sound of Buddha, the sound of Sangha, the sound of perfections, the sound of higher knowledge, the sound of approaching the Bodhi tree, up to the sounds of those with clinging and without clinging, he blessed them to be.

analyzed: sarvāḥ rajaḥ ndhakāra vāyavaḥ praśemuḥ
translated: All the dust, darkness, and winds subsided.

original: ye kecidiha cāturdīpike tṛṇagulmauṣadhivanaspatikṣitiśailaparvatāstān sarvān sapta mahāratnānadhyatiṣṭhat /
analyzed: ye kecid iha cāturdīpike tṛṇa gulma oṣadhi vanaspati kṣiti śaila parvatāḥ tān sarvān sapta mahā ratnān adhyatiṣṭhat
translated: Whatever grass, bushes, herbs, forests, earth, rocks, and mountains there are in this four-continent world, all of them were filled with the seven great jewels.

original: anava lokanataḥ mūrdhnā bhagavān yāvad brahmalokaṃ kāyena vaśaṃ vartayāmāsa /
analyzed: mūrdhnā bhagavān yāvat brahma lokam kāyena vaśam vartayāmāsa
translated: The Blessed One, with his body, brought under his control the entire world up to the Brahma realm.

original: ekaikasmācca lakṣaṇādbhagavatastādṛśī prabhā niścacāra yayā prabhayā trisāhasramahāsāhasralokadhātūdāreṇābhāsena sphuṭo 'bhūt /
analyzed: ekaikasmāt ca lakṣaṇāt bhagavataḥ tādṛśī prabhā niścacāra yayā prabhayā tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātu udāreṇa ābhāsena sphuṭaḥ bhūt
translated: And from each of the Blessed One's marks, such a radiance issued forth that the entire great trichiliocosm was filled with a great light.

analyzed: ye ca asyām tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrayām lokadhātau deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga preta piśāca kumā bhāṇḍa
translated: And all the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, pretas, piśācas, kumbhāṇḍas,

original: manuṣyāmanuṣyā nairayikā vā tairyagyonikā vā yāmalaukikā vā te sarve bhagavantamadrākṣuḥ
analyzed: manuṣya amanuṣyāḥ nairayikāḥ vā tairyagyonikāḥ vā yāmalaukikāḥ vā te sarve bhagavantam adrākṣuḥ
translated: humans, and non-humans in this great trichiliocosm, whether in the hells, animal realm, or world of Yama, all saw the Blessed One.

original: bahūni ca devanāgayakṣamanuṣyāmanuṣyaśatasahasrāṇi gaganasthāḥ puṣpairavākiran pradakṣiṇaṃ
analyzed: bahūni ca deva nāga yakṣa manuṣya amanuṣya śata sahasrāṇi gagana sthāḥ puṣpaiḥ avākiran pradakṣiṇam
translated: And many hundreds of thousands of gods, nāgas, yakṣas, humans, and non-humans in the sky scattered flowers,

analyzed: cakruḥ stuvantaḥ namaḥ cakruḥ
translated: circumambulated [the Blessed One] to the right, and praised him with hymns.

original: bahūni nairayikā tairyagyonikā yāmalaukikākṣobhyakoṭīśatasahasrāṇi smṛtiṃ pratilebhire /
analyzed: bahūni smṛtim pratilebhire
translated: Many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of beings from the hells, animal realms, and worlds of Yama regained mindfulness.

original: pūrvāvaropitakuśalamūlamanusmṛtya namo buddhāya iti kṛtvā tebhyo 'pāyebhyaścyavitvā deveṣūpapannaḥ /
analyzed: pūrva avaropita kuśala mūlam anusmṛtya namaḥ buddhāya iti kṛtvā tebhyaḥ pāyebhyaḥ cyavitvā deveṣu upapannaḥ
translated: Remembering the roots of virtue they had previously planted, they said, Homage to the Buddha! and having passed away from those lower realms, they were reborn among the gods.

original: tataśca mārasainyā dvāviṃśatimāraputraśatasahasrāṇi sapārṣadyāni bhagavata evaṃrūpaṃ prātihāryaṃ dṛṣṭvā bhagavato 'ntike atīva prasādaṃ pratilabdhvā
analyzed: tatas ca māra sainyāḥ dvāviṃśati māraputra śata sahasrāṇi sa pārṣadyāni bhagavataḥ evaṃrūpam prātihāryam dṛṣṭvā bhagavataḥ ntike atīva prasādam pratilabdhvā
translated: Then, the armies of Māra, the two hundred twenty thousand sons of Māra with their retinues, having seen such a marvel of the Blessed One, having attained great faith in the Blessed One,

original: yena bhagavāṃstenopajagmatuḥ /🔽upetya taiḥ sārdhaṃ pañcabhirmārakanyāśatairbhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya añjalīn pragṛhya ābhirgāthabhiradhibhāṣante sma /
analyzed: yena bhagavān tena upajagmatuḥ  upetya taiḥ sārdham pañcabhiḥ māra kanyā śataiḥ bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya añjalīn pragṛhya ābhiḥ gāthabhiḥ adhibhāṣante sma
translated: approached the Blessed One.

analyzed: dutt
translated: Having approached, together with the five hundred daughters of Māra, they bowed their heads to the feet of the Blessed One, joined their palms, and addressed him with these verses:

original: viśuddhamūrte paramābhirūpajñānodadhe kāñcanamerutulyam /🔽vitatya lokaṃ yaśasā vibhāsi tvāmeva nāthaṃ śaraṇaṃ brajāmaḥ // / //
analyzed: viśuddha mūrte parama abhirūpa jñāna udadhe kāñcana meru tulyam  vitatya lokam yaśasā vibhāsi tvām eva nātham śaraṇam brajāmaḥ
translated: Your form is pure, supremely beautiful, an ocean of knowledge, equal to the golden Meru.🔽You shine with glory, illuminating the world. We go for refuge to you alone, O Lord.

original: pranaṣṭamārge vinimīlitākṣe ulkāyase tvaṃ jagatīva sūryaḥ /
analyzed: pranaṣṭa mārge vinimīlita akṣe ulkāyase tvam jagatī iva sūryaḥ
translated: When the path is lost and the eyes are closed, you shine like the sun in the world.

original: aparājita prāṇinastvekabandhuṃ tvāṃ sārthavāhaṃ śaraṇaṃ vrajāmaḥ // / //
analyzed: aparājita prāṇinaḥ tu eka bandhum tvām sārthavāham śaraṇam vrajāmaḥ
translated: We go for refuge to you, the unconquered one, the sole friend of beings, the caravan leader.

analyzed: asaṃbhṛta jñāna samṛddha kośa nabhaḥ svabhāva ādi vimukta citta
translated: Your treasure of knowledge is not accumulated, your mind is liberated from the nature of space.

analyzed: karuṇa āśaya snigdha manojña vākya sarva artha siddham śaraṇam vrajāmaḥ
translated: We go for refuge to the one whose words are kind and pleasant due to the intention of compassion, the one who accomplishes all goals.

analyzed: saṃsāra kāntāra vimokṣakaḥ tvam sāmagritaḥ hetu phala pradarśakaḥ
translated: You are the one who liberates from the wilderness of saṃsāra, the one who shows the cause and effect from the collection.

analyzed: maitra vihārī parama vidhi jñaḥ karuṇā vihārī śaraṇam vrajāmaḥ
