translated: and who, needing a wife, would touch a barren woman.

original: puṣpārthikaḥ cīvaraṃ gandhārthiko manuṣyakuṇapaṃ cīvarārthikaḥ śmaśānaṃ vastrārthiko
analyzed: puṣpa arthikaḥ cīvaram gandha arthikaḥ manuṣyakuṇapam cīvara arthikaḥ śmaśānam vastra arthikaḥ
translated: One seeking flowers would take up a robe, one seeking perfume would take up a human corpse, one seeking a robe would take up a charnel ground, one seeking cloth would take up a stone, one seeking ointment would touch the sky.

analyzed: śmānam vilepana arthikaḥ ākāśam parāmṛśet evam eva bhadra mukhāḥ yaḥ caryā adhiṣṭhāna saṃga vyavacāra samucchraya dvaya adhiṣṭhānena
translated: In the same way, O good sirs, one who seeks omniscient knowledge through the two accumulations of conduct and basis,

analyzed: sarvajña jñānam paryeṣate niṣphalaḥ tasya vyāyāmaḥ
translated: his exertion is fruitless.

original: atha khalu tasyāmeva pariṣadi dhāraṇamatirnāma bodhisattvaḥ sannipatito 'bhūt sanniṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu tasyām eva pariṣadi dhāraṇamatiḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ sannipatitaḥ bhūt sanniṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Then in that very assembly, a bodhisattva named Dhāraṇamati had gathered and was seated.

analyzed: sa yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamaiyavam āha
translated: He bowed with folded hands in the direction of the Blessed One and said:

analyzed: yat bhagavan anabhilāpya dharmaḥ śakyam abhisamboddhum
translated: Blessed One, if the inexpressible Dharma can be fully awakened to,

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: the Blessed One said:

analyzed: eṣaḥ eva abhisaṃbodhaḥ yat anabhilāpyam jānīte
translated: This is the very full awakening, that one knows the inexpressible.

analyzed: tena hi kula putra tvām eva pravakṣyāmi
translated: Therefore, noble son, I will explain to you.

analyzed: yadi te kṣamam tathā vyākuru
translated: If it is acceptable to you, then explain accordingly.

original: asti dvayalakṣaṇabhāvo yaḥ sarvajñatā nāma labhate /
analyzed: asti dvaya lakṣaṇa bhāvaḥ yaḥ sarvajña tā nāma labhate
translated: Is there the nature of duality that obtains the name of omniscience?

analyzed: āha
translated: He said:

analyzed: yadi asti iti vakṣyāmi śāśvataḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: If I were to say 'it exists,' it would be eternal.

analyzed: atha na asti ceda vakṣyāmi ucchedaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: If it does not exist, we will say there will be annihilation.

analyzed: madhyamā ca pratipannā upalabhyate
translated: And the middle way is perceived.

analyzed: na asau asti na api na asti iti
translated: It is not that it exists, nor that it does not exist.

analyzed: jñānam eṣaḥ eva abhisaṃbodhaḥ
translated: The knowledge of these, which are without attachment, non-arising, non-decay, immeasurability, innumerability, darkness, and light, is itself full enlightenment.

analyzed: vidyunmatiḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: The bodhisattva Vidyunmati said:

original: yatra bhagavan nāgatirna gatirityeva jñānāvatārakauśalam eṣa evābhisaṃbodhaḥ /
analyzed: yatra bhagavat na agatiḥ na gatiḥ iti eva jñāna avatāra kauśalam eṣaḥ eva abhisaṃbodhaḥ
translated: Blessed One, where there is no coming or going, the skill in entering into knowledge is itself full enlightenment.

analyzed: vairocanaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: The bodhisattva Vairocana said:

original: yatra bhagavan na prāptilakṣaṇaṃ nābhisamayo na sākṣātkriyā na śamo na praśamo na trayadhvaṃ na triyānaṃ na praṇidhisāmīcīmanyanā eṣa evābhisaṃbodhaḥ🔽Dutt
analyzed: yatra bhagavat na prāpti lakṣaṇam na abhisamayaḥ na sākṣātkriyā na śamaḥ na praśamaḥ na trayadhvam na triyānam na praṇidhi sāmīcīmanyanā eṣaḥ eva abhisaṃbodhaḥ  dutt
translated: Blessed One, where there is no characteristic of attainment, no full enlightenment, no direct realization, no peace, no tranquility, no three times, no three vehicles, no mental construction of aspiration and practice, that is itself full enlightenment.

analyzed: dhāraṇa matiḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: The bodhisattva Dhāraṇamati said:

original: yo bhagavan na tradhātukaṃ na trīṇī saṃyojanāni na traividyatāṃ na triyānatāṃ na
analyzed: yaḥ bhagavat na tra dhātukam na trīṇi saṃyojanāni na traividya tām na triyāna tām na
translated: Blessed One, he who does not imagine or conceptualize the three realms, the three fetters, the state of the three knowledges, the state of the three vehicles,

original: skandhadhātvāyatanāni na kalpayati na vikalpayati na hāniṃ na vṛddhiṃ na sāmīcīṃ
analyzed: skandha dhātu āyatanāni na kalpayati na vikalpayati na hānim na vṛddhim na sāmīcīm
translated: the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, who does not cause loss or increase, who does not make right practice,

analyzed: karoti eṣaḥ eva abhisaṃbodhaḥ
translated: that is itself full enlightenment.

analyzed: vajramatiḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: The bodhisattva Vajramati said:

original: yaḥ pṛthagjanadharmaḥ vāryadharmo vā śaikṣadharmaḥ vāśaikṣadharmaḥ vā śrāvakadharmaḥ vā pratyekabuddhadharmaḥ na kalpayati na vikalpayati na
analyzed: yaḥ pṛthagjana dharmaḥ vā ārya dharmaḥ vā śaikṣa dharmaḥ vā aśaikṣa dharmaḥ vā śrāvaka dharmaḥ vā pratyekabuddha dharmaḥ na kalpayati na vikalpayati na
translated: He who does not conceptualize or discriminate the dharmas of ordinary people, the dharmas of the noble ones, the dharmas of those in training, the dharmas of those beyond training, the dharmas of the śrāvakas, or the dharmas of the pratyekabuddhas,

analyzed: sāmīcīm karoti eṣaḥ eva abhisaṃbodhaḥ
translated: and does not engage in proper conduct, this is true enlightenment.

analyzed: dṛḍha matiḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: The bodhisattva Dṛḍhamati said:

original: yo vivekanayena tathatāṃ vyavacārayati eṣa evābhisaṃbodhaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ viveka nayena tathatām vyavacārayati eṣaḥ eva abhisaṃbodhaḥ
translated: He who investigates suchness by means of the method of seclusion, this is true enlightenment.

analyzed: ratnapāṇiḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: The bodhisattva Ratnapāṇi said:

original: yo 'nutpādalakṣaṇaṃ sarvadharmāṇāṃ na prāptaye nābhisamayāya na kalpayati eṣa evābhisaṃbodhaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ na utpāda lakṣaṇam sarva dharmāṇām na prāptaye na abhisamayāya na kalpayati eṣaḥ eva abhisaṃbodhaḥ
translated: He who does not conceptualize the characteristic of non-arising of all phenomena for the sake of attainment or realization, this is true enlightenment.

analyzed: acintya matiḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: The bodhisattva Acintyamati said:

original: yastraidhātukavyavacāracittameva citte praveśayati ubhe citte na vyavacāryeṇopalabhate eṣa evābhisaṃbodhaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ traidhātuka vyavacāra cittam eva citte praveśayati ubhe citte na vyavacāryeṇa upalabhate eṣaḥ eva abhisaṃbodhaḥ
translated: He who causes the mind that investigates the three realms to enter the mind itself, and does not apprehend both minds by investigating, this is true enlightenment.

analyzed: arivijayaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: The bodhisattva Arivijaya said:🔽He who, having entered the mind, does not apprehend the mind, and does not apprehend the non-apprehension of the mind, this is true enlightenment.

original: yaḥ sarvadharmeṣu na sajyate nānunīyate nopekṣate na pratimanyate na spṛhayate na muhyate na gṛṇhāti na mucyate eṣa evābhisaṃbodhaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ sarva dharmeṣu na sajyate na anunīyate na upekṣate na pratimanyate na spṛhayate na muhyate na gṛṇhāti na mucyate eṣaḥ eva abhisaṃbodhaḥ
translated: He who is not attached to any dharma, is not seduced, does not ignore, does not become angry, does not desire, does not become deluded, does not grasp, and does not let go - this is true enlightenment.

original: padmagarbho bodhisattva āha /🔽yaḥ puṇyapāpayoḥ na sajjate gambhīrakṣāntinayāvatārāhaṅkāramamakārānna kalpayati eṣa evābhisaṃbodhaḥ /
analyzed: padmagarbhaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha  yaḥ puṇya pāpayoḥ na sajjate gambhīra kṣānti naya avatāra ahaṅkāra mamakārān na kalpayati eṣaḥ eva abhisaṃbodhaḥ
translated: The bodhisattva Padmagarbha said:

analyzed: dutt
translated: He who is not attached to merit and sin, who does not conceive of ego and possessiveness through entering the profound acceptance of emptiness - this is true enlightenment.

analyzed: candraprabhaḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ āha
translated: The bodhisattva Candraprabha said:

original: yo bhagavān praśamāt sarvadharmānna prajānīte na ca dharmāṇāṃ svabhāvamācayaṃ vopacayaṃ vā paśyati eṣa evābhisaṃbodhaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ bhagavān praśamāt sarva dharmān na prajānīte na ca dharmāṇām svabhāvam ācayam vā upacayam vā paśyati eṣaḥ eva abhisaṃbodhaḥ
translated: Blessed One, he who does not cognize all dharmas through pacification, and does not see the accumulation or increase of the nature of dharmas - this is true enlightenment.

analyzed: khagamatiḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ āha
translated: The bodhisattva Khagamati said:

original: yasya sarva tamaālokotpādavyayaḥ vṛddhihāniḥ cittacaitasikeṣu na pravartante eṣa evābhisaṃbodhaḥ /
analyzed: yasya vṛddhi hāniḥ citta caitasikeṣu na pravartante eṣaḥ eva abhisaṃbodhaḥ
translated: He for whom darkness, light, origination, cessation, increase, and decrease do not occur in the mind and mental factors - this is true enlightenment.

analyzed: akṣaya matiḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: The bodhisattva Akṣayamati said:

original: yastripariśuddhaḥ pāramitāsu abhyāsaṃ karoti anupalambhayogena na rajyate na virajyate eṣa evābhisaṃbodhaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ tri pariśuddhaḥ pāramitāsu abhyāsam karoti anupalambha yogena na rajyate na virajyate eṣaḥ eva abhisaṃbodhaḥ
translated: He who practices the perfections while being purified in three ways through the yoga of non-apprehension, and is neither attached nor detached - this is true enlightenment.

analyzed: mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ āha
translated: Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, said:

original: yo bhagavan sarvadharmeṣu na rajyate na virajyate gambhiradharmanayaṃ ca prajānāti /
analyzed: yaḥ bhagavan sarva dharmeṣu na rajyate na virajyate gambhira dharma nayam ca prajānāti
translated: Blessed One, one who does not delight in or turn away from any phenomena, and who understands the profound Dharma method,

original: yaśca prajānāti tannāyūhatinaniryūhati nākarṣati na vyākarṣati na ca kasyaciddharmasyāpacayaṃ
analyzed: yaḥ ca prajānāti tat na a yūhati na niryūhati na ākarṣati na vyākarṣati na ca kasyacid dharmasya apacayam
translated: and one who understands that does not grasp or reject, does not attract or repulse, and does not produce or destroy any phenomenon,

original: vāvidyāṃ vāvimuktiṃ cotpādayati vyayaṃ vā hānīṃ vā vṛddhiṃ vā vastuṣu na saṃkalpanato
analyzed: vā avidyām vā avimuktim ca utpādayati vyayam vā hānīm vā vṛddhim vā vastuṣu na
translated: does not conceive of or imagine increase or decrease, destruction or loss, or growth in things.

analyzed: na vikalpanataḥ eṣaḥ eva abhisaṃbodhaḥ
translated: This very non-conception is the full realization.

analyzed: anena eva nayena sarva abhisaṃbodhaḥ
translated: By this very method, there is full realization of everything.

analyzed: atha kautūhalikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: Then the bodhisattva Kautūhalika said:

analyzed: kim mañjuśrīḥ āyoga prayogena prayojanam
translated: Mañjuśrī, what is the purpose of the yoga practice?

analyzed: yat anena eka naya tathatā praveśena eva gambhīra bhāvanā nayena sarvajña jñāna parijñānam
translated: By entering this very single method of suchness, through the profound method of meditation, there is complete knowledge of the wisdom of omniscience.

analyzed: mañjuśrīḥ āha  viṣama dṛṣṭi rahitaḥ samyak dṛṣṭiḥ asamāropaḥ
translated: Mañjuśrī said:🔽Free from distorted views, right view is non-superimposition.

analyzed: a śāṭhya ṛjuka tā samāropaḥ
translated: Without deceit, straightforwardness is non-superimposition.

analyzed: pāpa rahitaḥ guru gaurava asamāropaḥ
translated: Free from evil, respect for the guru is non-superimposition.

analyzed: su vacanāsa samyak ājīvāsa sarva saṃyojana rahitāsa sama ākrośa sarva sattva kṛpāsa
translated: You are the one with good speech, the one who lives well, the one free from all bonds, the one who endures all beings with compassion, the one who is not angry,

analyzed: tri saṃvarāsa a visaṃvādana kuśala dharmāsa a vyupaśāntāsa saddharma ārakṣāsa sarva sattva a parityāgāsa
translated: the one with the three disciplines, the one who does not deceive, the one with wholesome qualities, the one who is not at peace, the one who protects the true Dharma, the one who does not abandon any being,

analyzed: sarva vastu parityāgāsa durbala sattva bala pratiṣṭhāpanāsa bhīta śaraṇa abhayāsa
translated: the one who gives up all things, the one who establishes weak beings in strength, the one who is a refuge and fearlessness for the frightened,

analyzed: ku mārga saṃprasthitānām kṣānti sauratyāḥ sarva grāha saṃga lakṣaṇā sarva rajaḥ tamaḥ skandha varjanā sarva pariṇāmanā phala vipāka varjanā samāropaḥ
translated: the one who sets those who have set out on bad paths on the path of practice, the one who is patient and gentle, the one who is free from all grasping and attachment, the one who avoids all passion and darkness, the one who avoids all dedications, results, and consequences, the one who is without superimposition.

analyzed: ime kula putra viṃśatiḥ prayogāḥ sarvajña jñānasya
translated: These, noble sir, are the twenty practices of omniscient knowledge.

analyzed: sarva akṣara ruta ghoṣa vacana vyāhāra vākya prabheda tathatā jñāna praveśena sarvajña jñānasya prayogaḥ
translated: The practice of omniscient knowledge is through the knowledge of the suchness of all letters, sounds, words, expressions, and statements.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata vacanāni anya tīrthika vacana tathatā praveśena sarva caryā tathatā praveśena
translated: All the words of the Tathagatas are the suchness of the words of other tīrthikas, the suchness of all practices,

analyzed: sarva puṇya upeta prajñāpāramitā prayoga tathatā praveśena sarva upādāna utpāda vyaya tathatā praveśena  sarva tri vimokṣa āśraya hetu karma dharma tathatā praveśena jñātvā sarvajña jñānasya
translated: By entering the suchness of the union of all merit and the perfection of wisdom, by entering the suchness of the origination and cessation of all grasping,🔽and by entering the suchness of the cause, action, and nature of all three liberations, one should know that

analyzed: prayoga avabodhaḥ bhavati
translated: the application to omniscient knowledge is understood.

analyzed: kautūhalikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: The bodhisattva Kautūhalika said:

original: yāvadetat mañjuśrīryadā imaṃ gambhīraṃ dharmanayamavabudhyate tadā na kaściddharma samanupaśyati yo dharmo deśyeta yasmai deśyeta yairvārthapadavyañjanairdeśyeta
analyzed: yāvat etat mañjuśrīḥ yadā imam gambhīram dharma nayam avabudhyate tadā na kaścid dharma samanupaśyati yaḥ dharmaḥ deśyeta yasmai deśyeta yaiḥ vā artha pada vyañjanaiḥ deśyeta
translated: This is so, Mañjuśrī, when one understands this profound Dharma method, then one does not see any dharma that is taught, to whom it is taught, or by which meanings, words, and letters it is taught.

analyzed: prakāśyeta
translated: It is revealed.

original: yaṃ vā punaḥ prajahyād yaṃ vā bhāvayed yaṃ vā parijānīyāt sarvadharmānabhilāpyayogena tathatāṃ praviśati saḥ sarvajñajñānamavabudhyate /
analyzed: yam vā punar prajahyāt yam vā bhāvayet yam vā parijānīyāt sarva dharma an abhilāpya yogena tathatām praviśati saḥ sarvajña jñānam avabudhyate
translated: Or, one who would abandon, cultivate, or fully understand anything, by the inexpressible nature of all dharmas, enters into suchness, and understands omniscient knowledge.

analyzed: bhagavān āha  sādhu sādhu kula putra su bhāṣitaḥ te yam eka nayena
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: sarvajña jñāna pratilābhaḥ
translated: Good, good! O son of noble family, this attainment of omniscient knowledge through the single method has been well-spoken by you.

analyzed: tat kutas sarva dharmāḥ hi a samāropaḥ
translated: Why is it so? Because all dharmas are non-superimposition.

original: anutpādāvināśakoṭīkaḥ avidyānirvāṇānutpādabhūtakoṭīkaḥ ākāśanirvāṇānutpādabhūta koṭīkaḥ anabhilāpyakoṭīkaḥ sarvadharmāḥ /
analyzed: anutpāda avināśa koṭīkaḥ avidyā nirvāṇa anutpāda bhūta koṭīkaḥ ākāśa nirvāṇa anutpāda bhūta koṭīkaḥ anabhilāpya koṭīkaḥ sarva dharmāḥ
translated: The ultimate point of non-arising and non-destruction, the ultimate point of the non-arising of ignorance and nirvana, the ultimate point of the non-arising of space and nirvana, the ultimate point of the inexpressible - all dharmas.

analyzed: evam sarva sattvāḥ
translated: Thus all beings.

analyzed: sarva dharmāḥ na dravya koṭīkaḥ sarva asaṃga vastutaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translated: All dharmas are not the ultimate point of substance, proclaimed as the sphere of non-attachment.

analyzed: sarva tri adhva traidhātuka skandha niṣkiñcana koṭīkaḥ tri saṃskāra śūnyatā koṭīkaḥ dharma skandha vipāka skandha ādayaḥ apacaya skandhāḥ na dravya koṭīkaḥ
translated: The ultimate point of the skandhas of the three times and three realms being nothing whatsoever, the ultimate point of the emptiness of the three conditioned things, the skandhas of dharmas, the skandhas of ripening, and so on, the skandhas of decrease are not the ultimate point of substance.

original: śūnyatābhūtakoṭyanabhilāpyārthasarvadharmasamanvāgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvajñajñānamavatarati /🔽tasmin khalu punaḥ sarvajñajñānapratilābhavyākaraṇe bhāṣyamāṇe viṃśatibhirmārakanyāmāraputragaṇapārṣadyasahasrairanutpattikeṣu dharmeṣu kṣāntiḥ
analyzed: śūnyatā bhūtakoṭi anabhilāpya artha sarva dharma samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarvajña jñānam avatarati  tasmin khalu punar sarvajña jñāna pratilābha vyākaraṇe bhāṣyamāṇe viṃśatibhiḥ māra kanyā māra putra gaṇa pārṣadya sahasraiḥ anutpattikeṣu dharmeṣu kṣāntiḥ
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who is endowed with the emptiness, the ultimate point, and the meaning of the inexpressible of all dharmas enters the knowledge of all knowledge.

analyzed: pratilabdhā
translated: When that explanation of the prediction of attaining the knowledge of all knowledge was being spoken, twenty thousand sons of Māra, the retinue and assembly of Māra's daughters, attained acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: audārikaṃ ca kāyaṃ vijahya manomayaṃ kāyaṃ pratilebhire /
analyzed: audārikam ca kāyam vijahya manaḥ mayam kāyam pratilebhire
translated: They abandoned their coarse bodies and attained a mind-made body.

analyzed: apareṣām api eṣām viṃśatīnām anutpattikadharmakṣānti pratilābhaḥ bhūt
translated: And for another twenty thousand of them, the attainment of acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas occurred.

original: dvinavatīnāṃ ca devamanuṣyabimbarāṇāṃ vicitravicitrāṇāṃ ca bodhisattvakṣāntidhyānadhāraṇīnāṃ pratilābho 'bhūt /
analyzed: dvinavatīnām ca deva manuṣya bimbarāṇām vicitra vicitrāṇām ca bodhisattva kṣānti dhyāna dhāraṇīnām pratilābhaḥ bhūt
translated: And for two hundred and ninety thousand gods and humans, the attainment of various and diverse bodhisattva acceptances, meditations, and dhāraṇīs occurred.

original: atha tāni viṃśatisahasrāṇi anutpattikadharmakṣāntipratilabdhānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ bhagavantaṃ divyaiḥ puṣpairabhikiranti abhiprakiranti 🔽sma /
analyzed: atha tāni viṃśati sahasrāṇi anutpattika dharma kṣānti pratilabdhānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām bhagavantam divyaiḥ puṣpaiḥ abhikiranti abhiprakiranti  sma
translated: Then those twenty thousand bodhisattva mahāsattvas who had attained acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas scattered divine flowers over the Blessed One and scattered them.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ ca pādau śirobhiḥ abhivandya evam āhuḥ
translated: They bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One and said this:

original: paśya bhagavan kalyāṇamitrasaṃsargavaśena sattvānāṃ sarvapuṇyopāyakuśalamūlāni manasikārāṇi bhavanti /
analyzed: paśya bhagavan kalyāṇa mitra saṃsarga vaśena sattvānām sarva puṇya upāya kuśala mūlāni manasikārāṇi bhavanti
translated: Look, Blessed One, by the power of associating with spiritual friends, the mental activities of beings' roots of virtue for all forms of goodness arise.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: karmapratyaya eṣa draṣṭavyaḥ kautūhalaprāptānāṃ ca sattvānāṃ bhagavān saṃśayachittyarthamimaṃ pūrvayogamudājahāra /
analyzed: karma pratyayaḥ eṣa draṣṭavyaḥ kautūhala prāptānām ca sattvānām bhagavān saṃśaya chitti artham imam pūrva yogam udājahāra
translated: This should be seen as the condition of karma. And for those beings who have attained curiosity, the Blessed One related this past event in order to cut through their doubts.

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ kulaputrā atīte 'dhvani aparimāṇeṣu mahākalpeṣu atikrāntesu asyāmeva
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam kula putrāḥ atīte dhvani aparimāṇeṣu mahā kalpeṣu atikrāntesu asyām eva
translated: In the past, noble ones, in the distant past, after innumerable great eons had passed,

original: cāturdvīpikāyāṃ yadāsīt tena kālena tena samayena dyutindhare mahākalpe vartamāne
analyzed: cāturdvīpikāyām yadā āsīt tena kālena tena samayena dyutindhare mahā kalpe vartamāne
translated: At that time, in that era, during the Dyutimān eon,

original: aṣṭaṣaṣṭivarṣasahasrāyuṣkāyāṃ prajāyāṃ tena ca kālena tena samayena jyotisomyagandhāvabhāsaśrīrnāma🔽tathāgato 'bhūt vidyācaraṇasampannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ
analyzed: aṣṭa ṣaṣṭi varṣa sahasra āyuṣkāyām prajāyām tena ca kālena tena samayena jyotisomyagandhāvabhāsaśrīḥ nāma  tathāgataḥ bhūt vidyā caraṇa sampannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ
translated: when the lifespan of beings was eighty-four thousand years, at that time, in that era, there was a Tathāgata named Jyotisoma-gandhāvabhāsa-śrī,

original: śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: a perfect Buddha, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed guide for those to be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One.

original: kliṣṭe pañcakaṣāye loke vartamāne ca caturṇāṃ parṣadāṃ triyānapratisaṃyuktāṃ sandeśayati sma /🔽tena khalu punaḥ samayena rājābhūt utpalavaktro nāma caturdvīpeśvaraścakravartī /🔽atha rājā utpalavaktro 'pareṇa kālasamayena sāntaḥpuraparivāraḥ sabalakāyo yena Dutt
analyzed: kliṣṭe pañca kaṣāye loke vartamāne ca caturṇām parṣadām tri yāna pratisaṃyuktām sandeśayati sma  tena khalu punar samayena rājā abhūt utpalavaktraḥ nāma catur dvīpa īśvaraḥ cakravartī  atha rājā utpalavaktraḥ pareṇa kāla samayena sa antaḥpura parivāraḥ sa balakāyaḥ yena
translated: In a defiled world with the five degenerations, he taught the Dharma connected with the three vehicles to the four assemblies.🔽At that time, there was a king named Utpalavaktra, a universal monarch ruling over the four continents.

analyzed: jyotisomya gandha avabhāsa śrīḥ tathāgataḥ tena upasaṃkrāmat
translated: Then, at another time, King Utpalavaktra, together with his harem, retinue, and army, approached the Tathāgata Jyotisoma-gandhāvabhāsa-śrī.

original: upasaṃkramya tasya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya bhagavantaṃ nānapuṣpairabhyavākirat🔽nānāgandhairnānādhūpaiśca pūjāṃ kṛtvā bhagavato bhikṣusaṃghasya pādau śirasābhivandyābhyāṃ
analyzed: upasaṃkramya tasya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya bhagavantam nāna puṣpaiḥ abhyavākirat  nānā gandhaiḥ nānā dhūpaiḥ ca pūjām kṛtvā bhagavataḥ bhikṣu saṃghasya pādau śirasā abhivandyābhyām
translated: He approached, bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One, and scattered various flowers over the Blessed One.

analyzed: gāthābhyām abhyaṣṭāvīt
translated: Having made offerings with various perfumes and various incense, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and the community of monks, and with two verses he praised:

analyzed: bhujaṃga amara ādibhiḥ atīva guṇaiḥ samabhiṣṭutaḥ pracura doṣa haraḥ
translated: You who are greatly praised by the serpent-like immortals and so forth, the remover of many faults,

original: dhanasaptakena ca hito jagato vada kena sūkṣmamatimān bhavati // / //
analyzed: dhana saptakena ca hitaḥ jagataḥ vada kena sūkṣma matimān bhavati
translated: Beneficial to the world through the seven riches, tell me, by what does one become of subtle mind?

analyzed: jagataḥ tamaḥ ghnaḥ śama dīpa kara cyuti janma jarā bhdavana śoka damaḥ
translated: You who destroy the darkness of the world, you who light the lamp of peace, you who tame the sorrow of birth, death, old age, and existence,

original: jagatastvapāyapathavārayatā vada kena mucyati ha mārapathā // / //
analyzed: jagataḥ tu apāya patha vārayatā vada kena mucyati ha māra pathā
translated: You who block the path of misfortune for the world, tell me, by what is one freed from the path of Mara?

original: atha khalu māraputrāḥ sa jyotisomyagandhavabhāsaśrīstathāgato rājānamutpalavaktrametadavocat /
analyzed: atha khalu māra putrāḥ sa jyotisomya gandha vabhāsa śrīḥ tathāgataḥ rājānam utpalavaktram etat avocat
translated: Then, sons of Mara, that Tathagata Jyotissomasugandhavabhassarasmi, the king Utpalvaktra, said this:

analyzed: tribhiḥ sat puruṣa dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ sūkṣma matiḥ bhavati
translated: A bodhisattva endowed with three qualities of a good man becomes of subtle mind.

analyzed: katamaiḥ tribhiḥ
translated: With which three?

analyzed: adhyāśayena sarva sattveṣu karuṇāyate
translated: With superior intention, he has compassion for all beings.

original: sarvasattvānāṃ duḥkhapraśamāya udyato bhavati Dutt mātṛvat /
analyzed: sarva sattvānām duḥkha praśamāya udyataḥ bhavati mātṛ vat
translated: He is dedicated to the removal of the suffering of all beings, like a mother for her child.

analyzed: sarva dharma ādīn nirjīva niṣpoṣa niṣpudgalān ānākaraṇasamān vyupaparīkṣate
translated: He examines all phenomena as devoid of life, devoid of sustenance, devoid of person, and as having the same nature of non-differentiation.

analyzed: ebhiḥ tribhiḥ dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ sat puruṣaḥ bodhisattvaḥ sūkṣma matiḥ bhavati
translated: Endowed with these three qualities, the good man, the bodhisattva, becomes one of subtle understanding.

original: aparaistribhiḥ mahārāja dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ satpuruṣo mārapāśeṣu na sajjate /
analyzed: aparaiḥ tribhiḥ mahā rāja dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ sat puruṣaḥ māra pāśeṣu na sajjate
translated: Great King, the good man who is endowed with three other qualities does not get entangled in the snares of Mara.

analyzed: katamaiḥ tribhiḥ
translated: What are the three?

original: yaduta sarvasattveṣvakrodhano bhavati anavatāraprekṣī sarvasattvasamadakṣiṇīyaḥ samasaṃjñāmayo bhavati /
analyzed: yat uta sarva sattveṣu akrodhanaḥ bhavati an avatāra prekṣī sarva sattva sama dakṣiṇīyaḥ sama saṃjñā mayaḥ bhavati
translated: He is without anger towards all beings, he does not seek to find fault with anyone, and he has the same perception of all beings as worthy of offerings.

analyzed: sarva dharmān eka nayena vyupaparīkṣate yat uta ākāśa samān niḥsaṃskārān anānātvān ajātān anutpannān aniruddhān
translated: He examines all phenomena in one way, namely as like space, as having no conditioning, as non-differentiation, as unborn, as non-arisen, and as unceasing.

analyzed: sarvān ākāśa vat dravya lakṣaṇa vigatān anupalambha yogena pratyavekṣate
translated: He observes all phenomena as like space, devoid of the characteristics of substance, by way of non-apprehension.

original: ebhirmahārāja tribhirdharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ puruṣo mārapāśeṣu na sajjate mārapathācca nirmucyate /
analyzed: ebhiḥ mahā rāja tribhiḥ dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ puruṣaḥ māra pāśeṣu na sajjate māra pathāt ca nirmucyate
translated: Great King, the man who is endowed with these three qualities does not get entangled in the snares of Mara and is freed from the path of Mara.

original: atha rājñaḥ utpalavaktrasyāgramahiṣī surasundarī nāma sā caturaśītibhiḥ strīsahasraiḥ parivṛtā puraskṛtā yena jyotisomyagandhāvabhāsaśrīstathāgatastenopajagāma
analyzed: atha rājñaḥ utpalavaktrasya agra mahiṣī surasundarī nāma sā caturaśītibhiḥ strī sahasraiḥ parivṛtā puraskṛtā yena jyotisomya gandha avabhāsa śrīḥ tathāgataḥ tena upajagāma
translated: Then the chief queen of King Utpalavaktra, named Surasundarī, surrounded and attended by eighty-four thousand women, approached the Tathāgata Jyotisoma-gandhāvabhāsaśrī.

original: upetya taṃ bhagavantaṃ jyotisomyagandhāvabhāsaśriyaṃ tathāgataṃ nānāpuṣpairabhyavakīrya ābhirgāthābhiradhyabhāṣata /
analyzed: upetya tam bhagavantam jyotisomya gandha avabhāsa śriyam tathāgatam nānā puṣpaiḥ abhyavakīrya ābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata
translated: Having approached, she scattered various flowers upon the Blessed Tathāgata Jyotisoma-gandhāvabhāsaśrī and addressed him with these verses:

original: asadṛguṇadhara vitimirakaraṇa cyutihara vada kathamihā yuvati /
analyzed: a sadṛś guṇa dhara vitimira karaṇa cyuti hara vada katham iha ā yuvati
translated: Bearer of incomparable qualities, remover of darkness, remover of falling away, say how a young woman

analyzed: bhavati ha puruṣaḥ
translated: becomes a man here, free from bad destinies,

analyzed: vinaya mana druta hita kara
translated: fortunate, disciplined, and quickly beneficial.

original: paramagatigata sugata praśamaratikara bhagavan tyajati yuvati tāṃ kathamiha puruṣaḥ /
analyzed: parama gati gata sugata praśama rati kara bhagavan tyajati yuvati tām katham iha puruṣaḥ
translated: Gone to the highest state, well-gone, bringer of peace and joy, Blessed One, how does a young woman leave that and become a man here?

original: vada mama laghu suvinaya parahitakara śamayātitimirā mama nayagaganāt // / //
analyzed: vada mama laghu su vinaya para hita kara śamaya ati timirā mama naya gaganāt
translated: Speak to me quickly, O well-disciplined one, O benefactor of others, dispel the great darkness from my sky of conduct.

original: asamasama jagati śramaṇa parama prathita guṇagaṇa smṛtivinayadhara /
analyzed: asamasama jagati śramaṇa parama prathita guṇa gaṇa smṛti vinaya dhara
translated: Unequalled one, in the world, supreme ascetic, renowned for your multitude of virtues, bearer of mindfulness and discipline,

original: mama yadi puriṣeha bhavati hi dharatā laghu vada vitimira sugatapathāmṛtam // / //
analyzed: mama yadi puriṣa iha bhavati hi dharatā laghu vada vitimira sugata pathā amṛtam
translated: If I am a man here, then quickly speak the nectar of the path of the Sugatas, free from darkness.

analyzed: evam ukte kula putra sa jyotisomya gandha avabhāsa śrīḥ tathāgataḥ tām surasundarīm agra mahiṣīm etat avocat
translated: When this was said, O son of noble family, that Tathāgata Jyotisoma-gandhāvabhāsaśrī said this to the chief queen Suvarṇaprabhā:

original: asti bhagini paryāyo yena mātṛgrāmo mātṛgrāmabhāvaṃ laghveva parivartayati pūrvākṣiptamātṛgrāmabhāvo
analyzed: asti bhagini paryāyaḥ yena mātṛgrāmaḥ mātṛgrāma bhāvam laghu eva parivartayati pūrva ākṣipta mātṛgrāma bhāvaḥ
translated: There is, O sister, a method by which a woman quickly changes her female state, and quickly exhausts the remaining female state projected in the past,

original: laghvaśeṣaṃ kṣīyate na ca bhūyo mātṛgrāmeṣu upapattiṃ pratigṛṇhāti yāvadanuttaraparinirvāṇe
analyzed: laghu aśeṣam kṣīyate na ca bhūyas mātṛgrāmeṣu upapattim pratigṛṇhāti yāvat anuttara parinirvāṇe
translated: and does not again take rebirth as a woman until the attainment of unsurpassed nirvāṇa.

analyzed: hānyāḥ hi anatra sva praṇidhānāt
translated: Because of the loss of her own vow.

original: tatra bhagini kataraḥ paryāyo yena paryāyeṇa mātṛgrāmo laghu puruṣo bhavati pūrvākṣiptaṃ ca mātṛgrāmabhāvaṃ laghvaśeṣaṃ kṣepayati /
analyzed: tatra bhagini kataraḥ paryāyaḥ yena paryāyeṇa mātṛgrāmaḥ laghu puruṣaḥ bhavati pūrva ākṣiptam ca mātṛgrāma bhāvam laghu aśeṣam kṣepayati
translated: There, O sister, what is the method by which a woman quickly becomes a man and quickly exhausts the remaining female state projected in the past?

original: iha bhagini iyaṃ ratnaketurnāma dhāraṇī mahārthikī mahānuśaṃsā mahāprabhāvā sarvamātṛgrāmabhāvakṣayakarī kāyavāṅmanoduḥkhavipākadauṣṭhulyaṃ
analyzed: iha bhagini iyam ratnaketuḥ nāma dhāraṇī mahārthikī mahā anuśaṃsā mahā prabhāvā sarva mātṛgrāma bhāva kṣaya karī kāya vāc manaḥ duḥkha vipāka dauṣṭhulyam
translated: Here, O sister, this dhāraṇī called Ratnaketu is of great meaning, of great benefit, of great power, it destroys all female states, and the painful ripening of bodily, verbal, and mental suffering,

analyzed: dutt
translated: Dutt

analyzed: niravaśeṣam kṣepayati
translated: It completely destroys.

original: asyāśca ratnaketudhāraṇyāḥ samāśrayaṇena mātṛgrāmasya mātṛgrāmabhāvo niravaśeṣo gacchati /
analyzed: asyāḥ ca ratnaketudhā araṇyāḥ samāśrayaṇena mātṛgrāmasya mātṛgrāma bhāvaḥ niravaśeṣaḥ gacchati
translated: And by relying on this Ratnaketu Dhāraṇī, the state of being a woman for a woman is completely exhausted.

analyzed: strī indriyam antardhāya puruṣa indriyam prādurbhavati
translated: The female organ disappears and the male organ appears.

original: puruṣaścāpi rūpavān sarvāṅgaparipūrṇo bhavati ṛjuḥ sūkṣmajñānakuśalo bhavati kāyavāṅmanaḥsukṛtakarmāntaḥ sucaritacārī sarvaśaturnirjetā bhavati
analyzed: puruṣaḥ ca api rūpavān sarva aṅga paripūrṇaḥ bhavati ṛjuḥ sūkṣma jñāna kuśalaḥ bhavati kāya vāc manaḥ su kṛta karmāntaḥ su carita cārī sarva śatuḥ nirjetā bhavati
translated: And the man also becomes handsome, with all limbs complete, upright, skilled in subtle knowledge, with good physical, verbal, and mental actions, a practitioner of good conduct, and a conqueror of all enemies.

original: yaścāsya dṛṣṭadharmasāṃparāyikaḥ kāyavāṅmanoduḥkhapratisaṃvedanīyo duṣkṛtānāṃ vāṅmanaḥkarmaṇāṃ phalavipākaḥ sa parikṣayaṃ gacchati /
analyzed: yaḥ ca asya dṛṣṭa dharma sāṃparāyikaḥ kāya vāc manaḥ duḥkha pratisaṃvedanīyaḥ duṣkṛtānām vāc manaḥ karmaṇām phala vipākaḥ sa parikṣayam gacchati
translated: And the result and ripening of the bad physical, verbal, and mental actions that are to be experienced as bodily and mental suffering in this life and the next for him are completely exhausted.

original: sthāpyānantaryakāriṇaṃ saddharmapratikṣepakamāryāpavādakaṃ ca teṣāṃ punastenaiva bhāvena parikṣayaṃ gacchati apariśeṣaḥ strībhāvaḥ /
analyzed: sthāpya ānantarya kāriṇam saddharma pratikṣepakam ārya apavādakam ca teṣām punar tena eva bhāvena parikṣayam gacchati a pariśeṣaḥ strī bhāvaḥ
translated: Except for one who has committed an immediate [evil], one who has rejected the true Dharma, and one who has slandered the noble ones, their female state is completely exhausted by that very state, without remainder.

original: kāyavāṅmanodauṣṭhulyavaipākikaḥ sumerumātraḥ pārajanmikaḥ strībhāvenāpi nivartako duḥkhavipākapratisaṃvedanīyaḥ karmāvaraṇapāpaniṣyandaniravaśeṣaḥ
analyzed: kāya vāc manaḥ dauṣṭhulya vaipākikaḥ sumeru mātraḥ pārajanmikaḥ strī bhāvena api nivartakaḥ duḥkha vipāka pratisaṃvedanīyaḥ karma āvaraṇa pāpa nisyanda niravaśeṣaḥ
translated: The ripening of the karma that is the basis for the body, speech, and mind, which is as large as Mount Sumeru, the future [rebirth] as a woman, which is the cause of suffering, the outflow of the karma that is the basis for the body, speech, and mind, which is the cause of suffering, is completely exhausted.

analyzed: parikṣayam gacchati
translated: [It] goes to complete exhaustion.

analyzed: tat kutas
translated: How is that?

original: tad yathā nāma iyaṃ ratnaketudhāraṇī sarvairatītaistathāgatairarhadbhiḥ samyaksambuddhairbhāṣitāścādhiṣṭhitā
analyzed: tat yathā nāma iyam ratnaketu dhāraṇī sarvaiḥ atītaiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksambuddhaiḥ bhāṣitāḥ ca adhiṣṭhitā
translated: Just as this Ratnaketu dhāraṇī was spoken and empowered by all the past tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas,

original: anyonyamanumoditāḥ stutā abhiṣṭutā varṇitāḥ sattvānāṃ duḥkhavipākakarmaparikṣayāya
analyzed: anyonyam anumoditāḥ stutāḥ abhiṣṭutāḥ varṇitāḥ sattvānām duḥkha vipāka karma parikṣayāya
translated: and mutually approved, praised, and extolled, for the complete exhaustion of the karma that results in suffering for sentient beings,

analyzed: kuśala mūla bivṛddhi tāyai
translated: and for the increase of wholesome roots.

original: ebhiḥ kecidetarhi daśasu dikṣu pratyutpannāstathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāstiṣṭhanti yāpayanti svakasvakeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu /
analyzed: ebhiḥ kecid etarhi daśasu dikṣu pratyutpannāḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ tiṣṭhanti yāpayanti svaka svakeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu
translated: Some of these [buddhas], who are now present in the ten directions, are tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas who abide and maintain [their existence] in their own buddha-fields.

original: sarve te buddha bhagavanta imāṃ ratnaketudhāraṇīṃ bhāṣante yāvat praśaṃsanti sattvānāṃ karmaparikṣayāya kuśalamūlavivṛddhaye /
analyzed: sarve te buddha bhagavantaḥ imām ratnaketu dhāraṇīm bhāṣante yāvat praśaṃsanti sattvānām karma parikṣayāya kuśala mūla vivṛddhaye
translated: All those buddhas, blessed ones, speak this Ratnaketu dhāraṇī, up to praising it, for the complete exhaustion of the karma of sentient beings and for the increase of wholesome roots.

original: ye 'pi te bhaviṣyanti anāgate 'dhvani daśasu dikṣu anyonyeṣu tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāste 'pīmāṃ ratnaketuṃ dhāraṇīṃ bhāṣiṣyanti Dutt
analyzed: ye pi te bhaviṣyanti anāgate dhvani daśasu dikṣu anyonyeṣu tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ te pi imām ratnaketum dhāraṇīm bhāṣiṣyanti
translated: Those who will be the Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones in the future, in the ten directions, in other worlds, they too will teach this Ratnaketu Dhāraṇī,

analyzed: yāvat praśaṃsiṣyanti sattvānām duḥkha vipāka karma parikṣayāya kuśala mūla vivṛddhaye
translated: up to in order to exhaust the karma that ripens as suffering for beings and to increase their roots of virtue.

analyzed: te ham api etarhi ratnaketum dhāraṇīm bhāṣiṣyāmi
translated: I too, at present, will teach this Ratnaketu Dhāraṇī.

original: anumodiṣyanti ca daśasu dikṣu pratyutpannānaṃ tathāgatānāṃ bhāṣamāṇānāmahamimāṃ ratnaketudhāraṇīṃ varṇayiṣyāmi praśaṃsiṣyāmi /
analyzed: anumodiṣyanti ca daśasu dikṣu tathāgatānām bhāṣamāṇānām aham imām ratnaketu dhāraṇīm varṇayiṣyāmi praśaṃsiṣyāmi
translated: And I will rejoice in the present Tathāgatas teaching this Ratnaketu Dhāraṇī in the ten directions, and I will praise it.

original: yaḥ kaścid bhagini rājā kṣatriyo mūrdhābhiṣikto janapadasthāmaprāptaḥ imāṃ ratnaketuṃ🔽dhāraṇīṃ pustake likhitvā dhārayiṣyanti tasya rājñaḥ kṣatriyasya daśasu dikṣū udāraḥ
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid bhagini rājā kṣatriyaḥ mūrdhābhiṣiktaḥ janapada sthāma prāptaḥ imām ratnaketum  dhāraṇīm pustake likhitvā dhārayiṣyanti tasya rājñaḥ kṣatriyasya daśasu dikṣu udāraḥ
translated: If any king, a Kṣatriya anointed on the head, who has attained stability in the country, O sister, were to write this Ratnaketu Dhāraṇī

analyzed: kīrti śabda ślokaḥ bhyudgamiṣyati
translated: in a book and keep it, the fame, renown, and praise of that Kṣatriya king would rise up in the ten directions,

analyzed: keṣāṃcid deva upapattaye dharmam deśayati

analyzed: māra karma pathā abhiyuktaḥ strīkaraṇa māyayā samanvāgataḥ sa śramaṇaḥ jyotisomya gandha avabhāsa śrīḥ

original: śramaṇarūpeṇa visaṃvādakaḥ yannūnaṃ vayamitaḥ prakramena na cāsya rūpaliṅgagrahaṇaṃ

analyzed: atha tatra eva kumārabhṛtaḥ nāma bhaṭaḥ
translated: Then there was a soldier named Kumārabhṛta there.

analyzed: saḥ evam āha
translated: He said this:

translated: My wife, my harem, and my daughters, all of their female organs were removed by this monk and transformed into male organs.

translated: And I am alone, afflicted with grief.

original: ete sarve vayaṃ samagrā bhūtvā viṣamaṃ mahāgahanaparvataṃ praviśāmaḥ /🔽yatra vayamasya mārapāśābhiyuktasya śramaṇakoraṇḍakasya śramaṇamāyāvinaḥ svaraghoṣamapi Dutt
analyzed: ete sarve vayam samagrāḥ bhūtvā viṣamam mahā gahana parvatam praviśāmaḥ  yatra vayam asya māra pāśa abhiyuktasya śramaṇa koraṇḍakasya śramaṇa māyāvinaḥ svara ghoṣam api

analyzed: na śṛṇuyāma prāk eva paśyāmaḥ iti

analyzed: te sarve tuṣṭāḥ evam āhuḥ
translated: They all rejoiced and said,

analyzed: evam astu iti
translated: So be it.

original: atha kumārabhṛto bhaṭastairvicikitsāprāptairbahubhiḥ prāṇakoṭībhiḥ sārdhaṃ prākrāmat pratyantime janapade viṣamaparvatagahane svaṛṣiveṣeṇa

translated: Then Prince Bhrata, having attained doubt, together with many millions of beings, departed to the borderlands, to the uneven, dense mountain forest, in the guise of a sage,

analyzed: caryām cacāra
translated: and practiced.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ ca sattvebhyaḥ evam dharmam deśayāmāsa
translated: And to those beings he taught the Dharma in this way:

analyzed: uccheda vādī ayam śramaṇaḥ utpannaḥ māra karma abhiyuktaḥ visaṃvādakaḥ
translated: This monk is a nihilist, engaged in the work of Māra, a deceiver.

analyzed: ye ca tam darśanāya upasaṃkramanti ye ca tam abhivādayanti ye ca asya dharmam śṛṇvanti te vikṣipta cittāḥ bhavanti
translated: And those who approach him to see him, those who greet him, and those who listen to his Dharma, they become distracted in mind.

analyzed: śirāṃsi ca eṣām muṇḍayati
translated: He shaves their heads.

analyzed: gṛhān nirvāsayati
translated: He banishes them from their homes.

analyzed: raktāni vāsāṃsi prayacchati  śmaśāna caryām cārayati
translated: He gives them red garments.🔽He makes them practice in the charnel ground.

analyzed: bhaikṣya caryāsu niveśayati
translated: He establishes them in the practice of begging.

analyzed: ekāhāriṇaḥ karoti
translated: He makes them eat only one meal a day.

analyzed: viṣama dṛṣṭi manasaḥ nitya udvignān viveka vāsa abhiratān layana prakṣiptān kāma rati nṛtya gīta gandha mālya vilepana ābharaṇa vibhūṣaṇa maithuna dharma surā madya pāna rahita analpa bhāṣiṇaḥ
translated: He makes them have an unstable mind with wrong views, delights in living in solitude, throws them into caves, and makes them abstain from sexual intercourse, alcohol, and meat, and speak little.

analyzed: karoti
translated: He does this.

original: evaṃrūpaḥ sa śramaṇaveṣeṇocchedavādī mārapathābhiyuktaḥ sattvānāṃ śatrubhūta utpannaḥ adṛṣṭaśrutapūrvametasya śramaṇagautamasya kriyopalakṣita
analyzed: evaṃrūpaḥ sa śramaṇa veṣeṇa uccheda vādī māra patha abhiyuktaḥ sattvānām śatru bhūtaḥ utpannaḥ a dṛṣṭa śruta pūrvam etasya śramaṇa gautamasya kriyā upalakṣita
translated: Such is he, a nihilist in the guise of an ascetic, engaged in the path of Mara, arisen as an enemy to beings, never before seen or heard of by the ascetic Gautama.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus it is said.

original: tena bahūni prāṇakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇyevaṃrūpāmimāṃ pāpikāṃ dṛṣṭiṃ grāhitānyabhūvan /

analyzed: dutt
translated: Dutt

translated: At another time, the great ascetic Utpalavaktra heard that in a certain mountain cave, some

analyzed: svayam kumārga saṃprasthitāḥ parān api etām viṣamām dṛṣṭim grāhayantaḥ trayāṇām ratnānām avarṇam

analyzed: cārayanti iti śrutvā ca asya etat abhavat
translated: They themselves have set out on the wrong path, and are causing others to adopt that perverse view, and are spreading disrepute about the Three Jewels. Having heard this, he thought:

original: yāvadahaṃ tāvat sattvāṃstataḥ pāpakāt dṛṣṭigatānna parimokṣayeyaṃ na ca samyagdṛṣṭau pratiṣṭhāpayeyaṃ nirarthakaṃ me śrāmaṇyaṃ bhavet /

translated: surrounded and attended by many hundreds of thousands of living beings, wandered through those border villages,

analyzed: strī bhāvāt nivartayitvā pratiṣṭhāpayāmāsa puruṣa tve

translated: Then, after that, I will frighten him as soon as he is born, absorbed in playing as a child, engaged in arts and crafts, studying, in the harem enjoying pleasures and amusements, up to when he is seated at the seat of enlightenment.

translated: having made him confess his wrongdoing, he caused him to generate the mind of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

translated: Then the soldier Kumārabhṛta, his faith well-established, made this aspiration:

translated: Good people, you may have doubt, uncertainty, or think that the one who at that time, on that occasion, was named Utpalavaktra, who made various kinds of offerings and services to the Tathāgata Jyotisoma-gandhāvabhāsaśrī, together with his retinue, and who, having renounced and gone forth together with many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of living beings,

analyzed: aprameyaḥ sattvaḥ phalaṣu pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ

translated: I had this kind of thought:

translated: that bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya was at that time, at that moment.

analyzed: syāt khalu bhadra mukhāḥ yuṣmākam kāṅkṣā vā vimatiḥ vā anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena kumārabhṛtaḥ nāma bhaṭaḥ bhūt sārdham prāṇa koṭībhiḥ
translated: O good people, if you have any doubt or uncertainty, thinking that the warrior named Kumārabhṛta, together with millions of lives, at that time, at that moment, was someone else,

analyzed: na khalu punar yuṣmābhiḥ evam draṣṭavyam
translated: You should not see it like that.

original: ayaṃ sa māraḥ pāpīmāṃstena kālena tena samayena kumārabhṛto nāma bhaṭo 'bhūt /

translated: Listen to these beneficial words of ours. You know the Dharma, don't you?

original: yat paśyanniha marasainyavilayaṃ nāyāsi śānti tataḥ /🔽bhrāntāḥ sma asamīkṣya saugatamidaṃ tejovapuḥ śrīghanaṃ
analyzed: yat paśyan iha mara sainya vilayam na āyāsi śānti tatas  bhrāntāḥ sma a samīkṣya saugatam idam tejaḥ vapuḥ śrīghanam
translated: Seeing the destruction of the demon army here, why do you not attain peace?🔽We are deluded, not having considered the Buddha's radiant body, his glorious essence.

analyzed: rūpam nā anyat iha uttamam su śaraṇam buddhāt ṛte nāyakam  dutt
translated: There is no other supreme refuge here, no leader like the Buddha.

original: athāparo māraḥ prarudan paramakrodhāviṣṭavacano māraṃ pāpīmantamevamāha /🔽kumārgasaṃprasthita mārgahīna prajānase na svabalaṃ na śaktim /
analyzed: atha aparaḥ māraḥ prarudan parama krodha āviṣṭa vacanaḥ māram pāpīmantam evam āha  ku mārga saṃprasthita mārga hīna prajānase na sva balam na śaktim
translated: Then another Mara, weeping and with words filled with supreme anger, said this to the evil one:🔽You are set on a bad path, devoid of the path. You do not know your own strength or ability.

original: na lajjase 'patrapase na caiva yastvaṃ saha spardhasi nāyakena // / //
analyzed: na lajjase patrapase na ca eva yaḥ tvam saha spardhasi nāyakena
translated: You are not ashamed or embarrassed, yet you compete with the leader.

original: asmabdalairyadvilayaṃ prayātaṃ buddhasya śaktyā tu jagat samagram /
analyzed: asmad dalaiḥ yat vilayam prayātam buddhasya śaktyā tu jagat samagram
translated: By our strength, we have come to destruction. But by the Buddha's power, the entire world,

analyzed: upāgamat padma samīpam āśu dharma śrava āpyāyita śuddha dehaḥ
translated: Quickly approached the lotus, with a pure body nourished by listening to the Dharma.

original: vayaṃ tu vībhatsatarāḥ prayātā durgandhakāyā balavīryanaṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: vayam tu vībhatsatarāḥ prayātāḥ durgandha kāyāḥ bala vīrya naṣṭāḥ
translated: But we have become even more repulsive, our bodies foul-smelling, our strength and vigor lost.

original: yāvanna yātā vilayaṃ kṣaṇena tāvad vrajāmaḥ śaraṇaṃ munīndram // / //
analyzed: yāvat na yātāḥ vilayam kṣaṇena tāvat vrajāmaḥ śaraṇam muni indram
translated: As long as we do not perish in an instant, for that long we go for refuge to the Lord of Sages.

analyzed: atha apare mārāḥ kṛtāñjalayaḥ evam āhuḥ
translated: Then other Maras, with folded hands, said this:

analyzed: pāpīman tvam apeta dharma caraṇaḥ pāpa kriyāyām
translated: O Evil One, you have abandoned the practice of Dharma and delight in evil deeds.

analyzed: nāthaḥ hi eṣa jagat hita artha kuśalaḥ buddhaḥ satām agraṇīḥ
translated: This Buddha is the protector, skilled in benefiting the world, the foremost of the virtuous.

original: āyāmo nagaraṃ drutaṃ vayamiha prītiprasannekṣaṇāḥ🔽gacchāmaḥ śaraṇaṃ trilokamahitaṃ sarvauṣadhaṃ prāṇinām // / //
analyzed: āyāmaḥ nagaram drutam vayam iha prīti prasanna īkṣaṇāḥ  gacchāmaḥ śaraṇam triloka mahitam sarva auṣadham prāṇinām
translated: Let us quickly go to the city here, with eyes of joy and delight.

analyzed: dutt
translated: We go for refuge to the one who is not hated in the three worlds, the medicine for all living beings.

original: atha tatraiva gaganaghoṣavatirnāma māraḥ sa uccasvareṇaivamāha /
analyzed: atha tatra eva gaganaghoṣavatiḥ nāma māraḥ saḥ ucca svareṇa evam āha
translated: Then there, a Mara named Gaganaghoṣavān, in a loud voice, said this:

original: sava yūyaṃ samagrāḥ śṛṇuta mama vaco bhaktitaḥ prītiyuktāḥ🔽pāpād dṛṣṭiṃ nivārya praṇatatanumanovāksamācāraceṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: yūyam samagrāḥ śṛṇuta mama vacaḥ bhaktitaḥ prīti yuktāḥ  pāpāt dṛṣṭim nivārya praṇata tanu manaḥ vāc samācāra ceṣṭāḥ
translated: All of you together, listen to my words with devotion and joy.🔽Turn away from evil views, with body, mind, speech, and conduct subdued.

analyzed: tyakta krodhāḥ prahṛṣṭa muni vara vacanāḥ sphīta bhakti prasādā
translated: Abandon anger, with the words of the excellent sages joyful, with abundant devotion and faith.

original: gatvā buddhaṃ samakṣaṃ śaraṇamasulabhaṃ pūjayāmo 'dya bhaktayā // / //
analyzed: gatvā buddham samakṣam śaraṇam asulabham pūjayāmaḥ bhaktayā
translated: Having gone to the Buddha, the one who is difficult to meet, we will now worship him with devotion.

original: atha tatkṣaṇameva sarve mārā gaganatalādavatīrya rājagṛhanagaradvārāṇi saptaratnamayāni cakruḥ /
analyzed: atha tad kṣaṇam eva sarve mārāḥ gagana talāt avatīrya rājagṛha nagara dvārāṇi sapta ratna mayāni cakruḥ
translated: Then, at that very moment, all the Māras descended from the sky and made the gates of the city of Rājagṛha out of the seven precious substances.

analyzed: kecid māra cakravarti rāja veṣam ātmānam abhinirmīya bhagavataḥ pūjā parāḥ tasthuḥ
translated: Some, having manifested themselves in the form of a Māra-cakravartin king, stood there devoted to worshipping the Blessed One.

original: kecid brahmaveṣaṃ kecidvaśavartiveṣaṃ kecinmaheśvaraveṣaṃ kecinnārāyaṇaveṣaṃ kecittuṣitaveṣaṃ
analyzed: kecid brahma veṣam kecid vaśavarti veṣam kecid maheśvara veṣam kecid nārāyaṇa veṣam kecid tuṣita veṣam
translated: Some in the form of Brahmā, some in the form of Vaśavartin, some in the form of Maheśvara, some in the form of Nārāyaṇa, some in the form of Tuṣita,

original: kecid yamaveṣaṃ kecicchakraveṣaṃ kecittrayastriṃśadveṣaṃ kecit kumāraveṣaṃ kecid
analyzed: kecid yama veṣam kecid śakra veṣam kecid trayastriṃśat veṣam kecid kumāra veṣam kecid
translated: some in the form of Yama, some in the form of Śakra, some in the form of the Thirty-Three, some in the form of Kumāra, some

original: vaiśravaṇaveṣaṃ kecid virūḍhakaveṣaṃ kecid virūpākṣaveṣaṃ kecid dhṛtarāṣṭraveṣaṃ
analyzed: vaiśravaṇa veṣam kecid virūḍhaka veṣam kecid virūpākṣa veṣam kecid dhṛtarāṣṭra veṣam
translated: in the form of Vaiśravaṇa, some in the form of Virūḍhaka, some in the form of Virūpākṣa, some in the form of Dhṛtarāṣṭra,

original: kecit prākṛtacaturmahārājaveṣaṃ kecit sūryaveṣaṃ keciccandraveṣaṃ kecittārakaveṣaṃ
analyzed: kecid prākṛta catur mahārāja veṣam kecid sūrya veṣam kecid candra veṣam kecid tāraka veṣam
translated: some in the form of ordinary Four Great Kings, some in the form of the sun, some in the form of the moon, some in the form of stars,

original: kecidasuraveṣaṃ kecid garuḍaveṣaṃ kecit kinnaraveṣaṃ kecinmahoragaveṣaṃ kecid ratnaparvataveṣaṃ
analyzed: kecid asura veṣam kecid garuḍa veṣam kecid kinnara veṣam kecid mahā uraga veṣam kecid ratna parvata veṣam
translated: some in the form of asuras, some in the form of garuḍas, some in the form of kinnaras, some in the form of mahoragas, some in the form of jeweled mountains,

original: kecit niṣkaveṣaṃ kecinnānāratnaveṣaṃ kecid ratnavṛkṣaveṣaṃ kecit kṣatriyaveṣaṃ kecidanyatīrthikaveṣaṃ🔽keciccakraratnaveṣaṃ kecinmaṇiratnaveṣaṃ kecidairāvaṇaveṣaṃ kecidvalāhakarājaveṣaṃ Dutt 🔽kecit strīratnaveṣaṃ kecit śreṣṭhimahāratnaveṣam ātmānamabhinirmīya tasthurbhagavataḥ pūjākarmaṇe /
analyzed: kecid niṣka veṣam kecid nānā ratna veṣam kecid ratna vṛkṣa veṣam kecid kṣatriya veṣam kecid anya tīrthika veṣam  kecid cakra ratna veṣam kecid maṇi ratna veṣam kecid airāvaṇa veṣam kecid valāhaka rāja veṣam  kecid strī ratna veṣam kecid śreṣṭhi mahā ratna veṣam ātmānam abhinirmīya tasthuḥ bhagavataḥ pūjā karmaṇe
translated: Some manifested themselves in the attire of a universal monarch, some in the attire of a precious jewel, some in the attire of Airāvaṇa, some in the attire of the king of clouds, some in the attire of a precious woman, some in the attire of a great merchant-banker, and remained there to perform acts of worship for the Blessed One.

analyzed: kecid nīlāḥ nīla varṇāḥ śveta varṇa alaṅkāra alaṃkṛtam ātmānam abhinirmīya bhagavataḥ pūjā karmaṇe
translated: Some manifested themselves as blue, with a blue complexion, adorned with white ornaments, and remained there to perform acts of worship for the Blessed One.

original: lohitān chatradhvajapatākāmuktāhārān dhārayantastālapramāṇāmātramuccatvena gaganatale tasthuḥ /🔽kecidavadātā avadātavarṇā mañjiṣṭhavarṇābharaṇavibhūṣaṇāḥ pītān chatradhvajapatākāna dhārayantastasthuḥ /
analyzed: lohitān chatra dhvaja patākā muktā hārān dhārayantaḥ tāla pramāṇā mātram ucca tvena gagana tale tasthuḥ  kecid avadātāḥ avadāta varṇāḥ mañjiṣṭha varṇa ābharaṇa vibhūṣaṇāḥ pītān chatra dhvaja patākān dhārayantaḥ tasthuḥ
translated: They held red parasols, banners, flags, and pearl necklaces, and remained in the sky at a height of one tāla tree.🔽Some were pure, with a pure complexion, adorned with ornaments the color of madder, and held yellow parasols, banners, and flags, and remained [there].

original: kecinmañjiṣṭhā mañjiṣṭhavarṇāḥ suvarṇābharaṇavibhūṣaṇā nīlān chatradhvajapatākān dhārayantastasthuḥ /
analyzed: kecid mañjiṣṭhāḥ mañjiṣṭha varṇāḥ suvarṇa ābharaṇa vibhūṣaṇāḥ nīlān chatra dhvaja patākān dhārayantaḥ tasthuḥ
translated: Some were madder, with a madder complexion, adorned with ornaments of gold, and held blue parasols, banners, and flags, and remained [there].

analyzed: kecid lohitāḥ lohita varṇāḥ śvetam ukta varṣam vavarṣuḥ
translated: Some were red, with a red color, and rained a white rain of flowers.

analyzed: kecid śvetāḥ śveta varṇāḥ lohitam ukta varṣam vavarṣuḥ
translated: Some were white, with a white color, and rained a red rain of flowers.

analyzed: kecid devarṣi varṇam ātmānam abhinirmīya gaganāt puṣpa varṣam abhipravarṣuḥ
translated: Some, having manifested themselves in the form of celestial sages, rained down a rain of flowers from the sky.

original: kecid bhagavataḥ śrāvakaveṣamātmānamabhinirmīya nānādivyagandhavarṣaṃ gaganādvavarṣuḥ /🔽kecid gandharvavarṇā nānādivyatūryāṇi parājaghnuḥ /
analyzed: kecid bhagavataḥ śrāvaka veṣam ātmānam abhinirmīya nānā divya gandha varṣam gaganāt vavarṣuḥ  kecid gandharva varṇāḥ nānā divya tūryāṇi parājaghnuḥ
translated: Some, having manifested themselves in the form of the Blessed One's disciples, rained down from the sky a rain of various celestial fragrances.🔽Some, having the form of gandharvas, played various celestial musical instruments.

original: kecit amarakanyāvarṇā nānāratnabhājaneṣu gandhodakaṃ dhārayantaḥ pṛthivīṃ siṣiñcuḥ /
analyzed: kecid amara kanyā varṇāḥ nānā ratna bhājaneṣu gandha udakam dhārayantaḥ pṛthivīm siṣiñcuḥ
translated: Some, having the form of celestial maidens, sprinkled the earth with fragrant water in various jeweled vessels.

analyzed: kecid kāla kṛṣṇa varṇāḥ gandhān pradhūpayāmāsuḥ
translated: Some, having the color of black as the end of the eon, burned incense.

original: keciddevaputrarūpeṇa nṛtyagītasvarān mumucuḥ /🔽kecinnānāvarṇā yena bhagavāṃstena prāñjalayo bhagavantaṃ tuṣṭuvuḥ /
analyzed: kecid deva putra rūpeṇa nṛtya gīta svarān mumucuḥ  kecid nānā varṇāḥ yena bhagavān tena prāñjalayaḥ bhagavantam tuṣṭuvuḥ
translated: Some, in the form of celestial boys, let loose the sounds of dance and song.🔽Some, of various colors, with palms joined, praised the Blessed One in the direction of the Blessed One.

original: kecinmārāḥ mārapārṣadyā api yasyāṃ diśi bhagavāṃstadabhimukhā nānāvidhāni maṇiratnāni dadhire bhagavataḥ pūjākarmaṇe /
analyzed: kecid mārāḥ māra pārṣadyāḥ api yasyām diśi bhagavān tad abhimukhāḥ nānāvidhāni maṇi ratnāni dadhire bhagavataḥ pūjā karmaṇe
translated: Some Māras and Māra's retinue, in the direction of the Blessed One, held various kinds of precious jewels for the sake of worshipping the Blessed One.

analyzed: kecid vīthī gṛha śaraṇa gavākṣa ūraṇa harmya catvara śṛṅgāṭaka kūṭāgāra dvāra vṛkṣa vimāneṣu
translated: Some, standing in the streets, houses, shelters, windows, courtyards, palaces, crossroads, intersections, towers, doorways, trees, and celestial mansions,

analyzed: sthitvā prāñjalayaḥ niṣeduḥ bhagavata pūjā karmaṇe
translated: sat with palms joined, in order to make offerings to the Blessed One.

original: atha sa māro yadā adrākṣīt sarvāṃstān mārān saparivārān śramaṇagautamaṃ śaraṇaṃ gatān tadā bhūyasyā mātrayā kṣūbdhastrasto bhrāntaḥ prarudannevamāha
analyzed: atha sa māraḥ yadā adrākṣīt sarvān tān mārān sa parivārān śramaṇa gautamam śaraṇam gatān tadā bhūyasyā mātrayā kṣūbdhaḥ trastaḥ bhrāntaḥ prarudan evam āha
translated: Then, when Māra saw all those Māras with their retinues had gone for refuge to the ascetic Gautama, he became even more agitated, frightened, confused, and weeping, he said this:

original: na bhūyo me sahāyo 'sti naṣṭā śrīrme 'dya sarvataḥ /
analyzed: na bhūyas me sahāyaḥ asti naṣṭā śrīḥ me dya sarvatas
translated: I have no companion anymore. My glory has now vanished completely.

original: bhraṣṭo 'smi māraviṣayāt kuryāṃ vīryaṃ hi paścimam // / //
analyzed: bhraṣṭaḥ smi māra viṣayāt kuryām vīryam hi paścimam
translated: I have fallen from the domain of Māra. I should exert my last strength.

original: mūlaṃ chindyāmahaṃ padmaṃ sattvā yena diśo 'vrajan /
analyzed: mūlam chindyām aham padmam sattvāḥ yena diśaḥ vrajan
translated: I will cut the root of the lotus from which beings have gone in all directions.

original: chedāt padmasya saṃbhrāntā etat syāt paścimaṃ balam // / //
analyzed: chedāt padmasya saṃbhrāntāḥ etat syāt paścimam balam
translated: From the cutting of the lotus, they will be confused. This would be my last strength.

original: iti saṃcintya māraḥ pāpīmān vāyuvadavatīrya gaganād yena tatpadmaṃ vīthīgataṃ tena prasṛtya tatpadmamādaṇḍādicchati ūddhartuṃ spraṣṭumapi na 🔽śaśāka /
analyzed: iti saṃcintya māraḥ pāpīmān vāyu vat avatīrya gaganāt yena tat padmam vīthī gatam tena prasṛtya tat padmam ādaṇḍāt icchati ūddhartum spraṣṭum api na  śaśāka
translated: Thinking this, the evil Māra descended from the sky like the wind, went to that lotus in the street, and tried to pull it out by the stalk. He was not even able to touch it.

original: patrāṇi chettumicchati na ca tāni dadarśuḥ /
analyzed: patrāṇi chettum icchati na ca tāni dadarśuḥ
translated: He tried to cut the petals but did not see them.

original: padmakarṇikāmapi pāṇinā parāhantumicchati tāmapi naiva lebhe /🔽tad yathā vidyud dṛśyate na copalabhyate /
analyzed: padma karṇikām api pāṇinā parāhantum icchati tām api nā eva lebhe  tat yathā vidyut dṛśyate na ca upalabhyate
translated: He wanted to strike the lotus with his hand, but he could not even reach it.🔽Just as lightning is seen but not obtained,

original: tad yathā vā chāyā dṛśyate na copalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā vā chāyā dṛśyate na ca upalabhyate
translated: or just as a shadow is seen but not obtained,

original: evameva tat padmaṃ dṛśyate na copalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva tat padmam dṛśyate na ca upalabhyate
translated: in the same way that lotus was seen but not obtained.

original: yadā ca māraḥ pāpīmān tat padmaṃ dadarśa na copalebhe na pasparśa atha punaḥ sarvaparṣat saṃtrāsanārtham uccaiḥ mahābhairavaṃ svaraṃ moktumicchati
analyzed: yadā ca māraḥ pāpīmān tat padmam dadarśa na ca upalebhe na pasparśa atha punar sarva parṣad saṃtrāsana artham uccais mahā bhairavam svaram moktum icchati  /
translated: When Māra, the evil one, saw that lotus but did not obtain it, did not touch it, then he wanted to emit a loud, very frightening sound in order to terrify the entire assembly.

analyzed: tat api na śaśāka
translated: But he was not able to do that either.

original: na punarmahābalavegena ubhābhyāṃ pāṇibhyāmicchati mahāpṛthivīṃ parāhantuṃ kampayituṃ tadapi spraṣṭuṃ na śaśāka naivopalebhe /
analyzed: na punar mahā bala vegena ubhābhyām pāṇibhyām icchati mahā pṛthivīm parāhantum kampayitum tat api spraṣṭum na śaśāka na eva upalebhe
translated: Then with great strength and force he wanted to strike the great earth with both hands, to make it tremble, but he was not able to touch it, did not obtain it.

analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kaścid
translated: Just as if someone

analyzed: ākāśam icchet parāmarṣṭum na ca upalabhate
translated: wanted to grasp space, but does not obtain it,

original: evameva māraḥ pāpīmān dadarśa pṛthivīṃ na ca pasparśa nopalebhe /
analyzed: evam eva māraḥ pāpīmān dadarśa pṛthivīm na ca pasparśa na upalebhe
translated: in the same way Māra, the evil one, saw the earth but did not touch it, did not obtain it.

analyzed: tasya etat abhavat
translated: This occurred to him:

original: yattvahaṃ yathā saṃnipatitānāṃ sattvānāṃ prahāraṃ dadyāṃ cittavikṣepaṃ vā kuryām iti /
analyzed: yat tu aham yathā saṃnipatitānām sattvānām prahāram dadyām citta vikṣepam vā kuryām iti
translated: But I will give a blow to the assembled beings and cause confusion in their minds.

original: dadarśa tān sattvān na caikasattvamapi upalebhe na ca pasparśa /
analyzed: dadarśa tān sattvān na ca eka sattvam api upalebhe na ca pasparśa
translated: He saw those beings, but did not find even one being, nor did he touch one.

original: atha bhūyasyā mātrayā māraḥ pāpīmān ruroda /
analyzed: atha bhūyasyā mātrayā māraḥ pāpīmān ruroda
translated: Then Māra, the evil one, wept even more.

original: buddhanubhāvena cāsya sarvaṃ śarīraṃ vṛkṣavat cakampe /
analyzed: buddhanubhāvena ca asya sarvam śarīram vṛkṣa vat cakampe
translated: And by the Buddha's power, his whole body trembled like a tree.

analyzed: sa aśru mukhaḥ caturdiśam ca vyavalokayan evam āha
translated: With a tearful face, he looked in the four directions and said:

analyzed: māyā eṣā śramaṇena sarva jagataḥ dyā varjana artham kṛtā
translated: This is an illusion created by the ascetic today to attract the whole world,

original: yenāhaṃ purato vimohita ida bhrāntiṃ gato 'smi kṣaṇāt /
analyzed: yena aham puratas vimohitaḥ bhrāntim gataḥ smi kṣaṇāt
translated: By which I was deluded in front and became confused in an instant.

original: bhraṣṭo 'haṃ viṣayāt svapuṇyabalataḥ kṣīṇaṃ ca me jīvitaṃ
analyzed: bhraṣṭaḥ ham viṣayāt sva puṇya balataḥ kṣīṇam ca me jīvitam
translated: I have fallen from my domain, my merit and power are exhausted, and my life is over.

original: śīghraṃ yāmi nirākṛtaḥ svabhavanaṃ yāvanna yāmi kṣayam // / //
analyzed: śīghram yāmi nirākṛtaḥ sva bhavanam yāvat na yāmi kṣayam
translated: I will quickly go, rejected, to my own abode, before I am destroyed.

original: svabhavanamapi gantumicchati na tatrāpi śaśāka gantum /
analyzed: sva bhavanam api gantum icchati na tatra api śaśāka gantum
translated: He wanted to go to his own abode, but he was not able to go there either.

analyzed: sa bhūyasyā mātrayā trastaḥ ruroda
translated: He was even more frightened and wept.

analyzed: evam ca asya udapādi
translated: And this occurred to him:

analyzed: parikṣīṇaḥ ham ṛddhi balāt mā ahya eva aham śramaṇasya vaśam āgaccheyam
translated: I am exhausted from my magical power. I will go under the control of the ascetic.
