analyzed: ye ṭavī madhya gatāḥ bhramanti saṃsāra kāntāra vinaṣṭa mārgāḥ
translated: Those who wander lost in the midst of this wilderness, on the wrong path in the wilderness of saṃsāra,

analyzed: teṣām sva mārgam pratidarśayasva pramokṣaya ārya uttama dharma vāgbhiḥ
translated: Show them the right path with your liberating words of the supreme Dharma.

analyzed: etat tava āścaryataram kṛpā adbhutam pravartitam yat vara dharma cakram
translated: This is your even more wondrous and marvelous act of compassion, that you have turned the wheel of the supreme Dharma.

original: ciraṃ hi tiṣṭha tvamudārabuddhe mā khalvanāthā janatā bhavet // / //
analyzed: ciram hi tiṣṭha tvam udāra buddhe mā khalu anāthā janatā bhavet
translated: Remain for a long time, O Buddha of vast wisdom, so that the people may not be without a protector.

analyzed: atha aparā api devatā evam āha
translated: Then another deity said this:

original: nāśaṃ prayāsyatyatha yadvināyako lokastathāndho nikhilo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: nāśam prayāsyati atha yat vināyakaḥ lokaḥ tathā andhaḥ nikhilaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: When the Obstructer perishes, the world will be completely blind and lost.

analyzed: aṣṭāṅga mārgaḥ tri vimokṣa hetoḥ sarveṇa sarvam na bhaviṣyati iha
translated: The eightfold path, the cause of the three liberations, will completely cease to exist here.

analyzed: asmābhiḥ asmin śubha bījam uptam vaḥ kāya cetaḥ uddharam apramattaiḥ
translated: We have sown this good seed in you, being heedful in uplifting body and mind.

original: tato vayaṃ sarvasukhaiḥ samanvitāḥ puṇyākarasyāsya hi mā bhavet kṣayaḥ // / //🔽Dutt
analyzed: tatas vayam sarva sukhaiḥ samanvitāḥ puṇya ākarasya asya hi mā bhavet kṣayaḥ 🔽dutt
translated: Therefore, may we all be endowed with all happiness, and may there be no destruction of this source of merit.

original: tena ca samayena bahūni śuddhāvāsadevakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi tatraiva sannipatitānyabhūvan /
analyzed: tena ca samayena bahūni śuddhāvāsa deva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi tatra eva sannipatitāni abhūvan
translated: At that time, many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of gods from the Pure Abodes had also assembled there.

analyzed: tāni api evam āhuḥ
translated: They also said this:

original: mā bhaiṣṭaṃ yūyaṃ na muneravasthā bhaviṣyati kācidudārabuddheḥ /
analyzed: mā bhaiṣṭam yūyam na muneḥ avasthā bhaviṣyati kācid udāra buddheḥ
translated: Do not be afraid. No misfortune will befall the Muni, the one of vast wisdom.

original: pratyakṣapūrvā vayamasya sādhorūpāgatā yadbhuvi mārakoṭyaḥ // / //🔽ṣaṭtriṃśadyojanāni plutarabhasaparā yat samantād vitatya
analyzed: pratyakṣa pūrvāḥ vayam asya sādhoḥ ūpāgatāḥ yat bhuvi māra koṭyaḥ  ṣaṭtriṃśat yojanāni pluta rabhasa parāḥ yat samantāt vitatya
translated: We have seen with our own eyes how the millions of Māras on earth have come to this.🔽The terrifying army of Māra, which had spread out in all directions for thirty-six leagues with great speed and force,

analyzed: prāsa asi sphīta khaḍga pracura khara ravā bhīṣaṇī māra senā
translated: with its abundant spears, swords, and sharp-sounding scimitars,

analyzed: saṃprāptā bodhimaṇḍe vilayam upagatā tad kṣaṇāt eva bhītā
translated: has reached the seat of enlightenment and been destroyed in an instant out of fear.

analyzed: prāpta arthasya adya kim tad prasṛta yaśasaḥ vighnam eva prakuryāt
translated: What obstacle could it possibly create now for the one who has attained his goal and whose fame has spread?

original: athāparā devatā prarudantī evamāha /🔽mārasyaikasya sā senā prāgāsinna mahābalā /
analyzed: atha aparā devatā prarudantī evam āha  mārasya ekasya sā senā mahā balā
translated: Then another god, weeping, said this:🔽This great and powerful army was formerly that of a single Māra.

original: mārakoṭīsahasrāṇāmiyaṃ senā mahābalā // / //🔽niḥsaṃśayamiha prāpto nāśaṃ lokavināyakaḥ /
analyzed: māra koṭī sahasrāṇām iyam senā mahā balā  niḥsaṃśayam iha prāptaḥ nāśam loka vināyakaḥ
translated: This great and powerful army is now that of millions of Māras.🔽There is no doubt that the world's guide will be destroyed here.

analyzed: yad vināśat ayam lokaḥ nirālokaḥ bhramiṣyati
translated: When he is destroyed, the world will wander without a light.

original: atha khalu te śakrabrahmalokapālā bhagavataḥ pādau parivajyaivamāhuḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu te śakra brahma lokapālāḥ bhagavataḥ pādau parivajya evam āhuḥ
translated: Then indeed those Śakra, Brahmā, and Lokapāla lords, having circumambulated the Blessed One's feet, said this:

original: tiṣṭheha sādhu kuru mandadhīnāmasmadvacaḥ kāruṇikapradhāna /🔽bahudevakoṭyo mahāśoka taptāstāḥ sāṃprataṃ dharmarasena siñca // / //
analyzed: tiṣṭha iha sādhu kuru manda dhīnām asmad vacaḥ kāruṇika pradhāna  bahu deva koṭyaḥ mahā aśoka taptāḥ tāḥ sāṃpratam dharma rasena siñca
translated: Stay here, good one, do this for us, the slow-witted, O compassionate one, speak these words.

analyzed: dutt
translated: Many millions of gods are tormented by great sorrow, now sprinkle them with the nectar of the Dharma.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstāṃ sarvāvatīṃ parṣadaṃ maitryā viśālabhyāṃ nayanābhyām avalokya brāhmeṇa svareṇa tāṃ samāśvāsayannevamāha /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tām sarvāvatīm parṣadam maitryā viśālabhyām nayanābhyām avalokya brāhmeṇa svareṇa tām samāśvāsayan evam āha
translated: Then indeed the Blessed One, having looked with his vast eyes of friendliness upon that entire assembly, comforting them with his Brahmā voice, spoke thus:

original: mā bhaiṣṭa yūyaṃ bhavatādya nirbhayāḥ sarve 'pi mārāḥ sagaṇāḥ savāhanāḥ /
analyzed: mā bhaiṣṭa yūyam bhavata adya nirbhayāḥ sarve mārāḥ sa gaṇāḥ sa vāhanāḥ
translated: Do not fear, be fearless today, all of you, all the Māras with their hordes and vehicles,

original: śaktā na me bhīṣayituṃ samagrāḥ romāpyathaikaṃ kimu sarvadeham // / //🔽āśvāsayāmyadya tu sarvalokaṃ dharmaṃ sadāhaṃ bhuvi deśayiṣye /
analyzed: śaktāḥ na me bhīṣayitum samagrāḥ romāpi atha ekam kimu sarva deham  āśvāsayāmi adya tu sarva lokam dharmam sadā aham bhuvi deśayiṣye
translated: are not able to frighten me, let alone my entire body, even a single hair.🔽I comfort the entire world today, I will always teach the Dharma on earth.

analyzed: mārga cyutānām aham eva samyak mārga upadeśam viśadam kariṣye
translated: I myself will clearly give the teaching of the true path to those who have fallen from the path.

original: kṛtāni pūrvaṃ bahu duṣkarāṇi mayānnapānaṃ vipulaṃ pradattam /
analyzed: kṛtāni pūrvam bahu duṣkarāṇi mayā anna pānam vipulam pradattam
translated: Many difficult deeds were done by me in the past, much food and drink was given by me.

original: āvāsabhaiṣajyamanalpakaṃ ca kartuṃ vighātaṃ mama ko 'dya śakyate // / //
analyzed: āvāsa bhaiṣajyam analpakam ca kartum vighātam mama kaḥ śakyate
translated: Who could possibly create obstacles for me now, in providing abundant dwellings and medicine?

original: tyaktā maya hyaśvarathā gajāśca vibhūṣaṇānyābharaṇāni caiva /
analyzed: tyaktāḥ hi aśva rathāḥ gajāḥ ca vibhūṣaṇāni ābharaṇāni ca eva
translated: I have given up horses, chariots, and elephants, ornaments and adornments,

original: dāsāśca dāsyo nigamāśca rāṣṭrāḥ kartuṃ vighātaṃ mama kaḥ samarthaḥ // / //
analyzed: dāsāḥ ca dāsyaḥ nigamāḥ ca rāṣṭrāḥ kartum vighātam mama kaḥ samarthaḥ
translated: servants, male and female slaves, cities and kingdoms. Who could possibly create obstacles for me?

original: bhāryā sutā duhitṛ kalatravargamaiśvaryamiṣṭaṃ bhuvi rājavaṃśaḥ /🔽Dutt
analyzed: bhāryā sutā duhitṛ kalatra vargam aiśvaryam iṣṭam bhuvi rāja vaṃśaḥ  dutt
translated: My wife, sons, daughters, and retinue, the desired sovereignty on earth, the royal lineage,

original: datto mayā sattvahitāya kasmāccharīranāśo 'dya bhaviṣyati me // / //
analyzed: dattaḥ mayā sattva hitāya kasmāt śarīra nāśaḥ dya bhaviṣyati me
translated: I have given all this for the benefit of beings. Why should my body be destroyed today?

original: śiraśca netre ubhe karṇanāse hastau ca pādau tanu carma lohitam /
analyzed: śiraḥ ca netre ubhe karṇa nāse hastau ca pādau tanu carma lohitam
translated: My head, two eyes, two ears and nose, hands and feet, skin and blood,

original: svajīvitaṃ tyaktamapīha dehināṃ kartuṃ vihiṃsāṃ mama kaḥ samarthaḥ // / //
analyzed: sva jīvitam tyaktam api iha dehinām kartum vihiṃsām mama kaḥ samarthaḥ
translated: even my own life, I have given up for embodied beings. Who could possibly harm me?

original: bavhayo mayātīva hi buddhakoṭyaḥ saṃpūjitā bhaktimatā sahastam /
analyzed: bavhayaḥ mayā atīva hi buddha koṭyaḥ saṃpūjitāḥ bhaktimatā sa hastam
translated: I have worshipped many tens of millions of Buddhas with devotion and reverence,

original: śīlaśrutikṣāntiratena nityaṃ kartuṃ vilopaṃ mamaḥ samarthaḥ // / //
analyzed: śīla śruti kṣānti ratena nityam kartum vilopam mamaḥ samarthaḥ
translated: always delighting in morality, learning, and patience. Who could possibly destroy me?

original: pūrvaṃ mayā vai bahu duṣkarāṇi kṛtāni me 'tīva samāhitena /
analyzed: pūrvam mayā vai bahu duṣkarāṇi kṛtāni me tīva samāhitena
translated: In the past, I have performed many difficult tasks with great concentration.

original: saṃchinnagātreṇa na roṣitaṃ manaḥ kartuṃ vihiṃsāṃ mama ko 'dya śaktaḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃchinna gātreṇa na roṣitam manaḥ kartum vihiṃsām mama kaḥ śaktaḥ
translated: Even though my body is cut up, my mind is not angry. Who is able to harm me now?

original: kleśā jitā me nitayo 'smi buddhaḥ sarveṣu sattveṣu ca maitracittaḥ /
analyzed: kleśāḥ jitāḥ me smi buddhaḥ sarveṣu sattveṣu ca maitra cittaḥ
translated: My afflictions are conquered, I am a Buddha, and I have a loving mind towards all beings.

original: īrṣyā ca me nāsti khilaṃ na roṣo na me samarthaḥ purato 'dya kaścit // / //🔽jitaṃ mayā mārabalaṃ samagraṃ parājitā me bahu mārakoṭyaḥ /
analyzed: īrṣyā ca me nā asti khilam na roṣaḥ na me samarthaḥ puratas kaścid  jitam mayā māra balam samagram parājitāḥ me bahu māra koṭyaḥ
translated: I have no envy, no malice, no anger. No one is able to stand before me.

analyzed: dutt
translated: I have conquered the entire power of Mara. Many millions of Maras have been defeated by me.

original: yuṣmadvimokṣa niyataṃ kariṣye mā bhaiṣṭa kasmānna puraṃ pravekṣepa // / //
analyzed: yuṣmad vimokṣa niyatam kariṣye mā bhaiṣṭa kasmāt na puram
translated: You should not be afraid. I will certainly liberate you. Do not be afraid. Why should I not enter the city?

original: ye keci diśāsu daśaśvapīha buddhā hi tiṣṭhanti tu sattvahetoḥ /
analyzed: ye diśāsu daśaśu api iha buddhāḥ hi tiṣṭhanti tu sattva hetoḥ
translated: Whatever Buddhas there are in the ten directions, they remain for the sake of beings.

analyzed: tān sarva buddhān iha aikika riṣye mahardhikān ca api atha bodhisattvān
translated: I will bring all those Buddhas here, and also the powerful Bodhisattvas.

original: kṣetraṃ prapūrṇaṃ sakalaṃ kariṣye jñānena puṇyena ca vāsayiṣye /
analyzed: kṣetram prapūrṇam sakalam kariṣye jñānena puṇyena ca vāsayiṣye
translated: I will make the realm completely full. I will cause it to be inhabited by wisdom and merit.

original: taireva buddhaiḥ saha netṛsaṃsthitaḥ kariṣye buddhānumataṃ ca kāryam // / //
analyzed: taiḥ eva buddhaiḥ saha netṛ saṃsthitaḥ kariṣye buddha anumatam ca kāryam
translated: Together with those very Buddhas, I will accomplish the task approved by the Buddhas.

analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena aprameya asaṃkhyeyāni deva nāga yakṣa rākṣasa asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga manuṣya amanuṣya koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi bhagavate
translated: At that time, immeasurable and incalculable hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of devas, nāgas, yakṣas, rākṣasas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans gave the Blessed One

analyzed: sādhukāram pradaduḥ
translated: the sound of Excellent!

analyzed: evam ca āhuḥ
translated: And they said:

analyzed: namaḥ āścarya adbhuta asaṃkhyeya vīrya samanvāgatāya
translated: Homage to the one endowed with inconceivable, wondrous, immeasurable diligence.

analyzed: namaḥ namaḥ mahā āścarya samanvāgatāya buddhāya bhagavate
translated: Homage, homage to the Buddha, the Blessed One, endowed with great wonders.

original: āśvāsito bhagavatā sadevako lokaḥ parājito bhagavatā mārapakṣaḥ vidhūtaṃ sattvānāṃ sandhikleśakāluṣyam /
analyzed: āśvāsitaḥ bhagavatā sa devakaḥ lokaḥ parājitaḥ bhagavatā māra pakṣaḥ vidhūtam sattvānām sandhi kleśa kāluṣyam
translated: The world with its devas has been comforted by the Blessed One. The faction of Māra has been defeated by the Blessed One. The defilements and impurities of the knots of afflictions of beings have been removed.

analyzed: prahāṇaḥ sattvānām māna parvataḥ
translated: The mountain of pride of beings has been destroyed.

analyzed: chinnaḥ janma vṛkṣaḥ  vicūrṇitaḥ  mṛtyu sūryaḥ
translated: The tree of birth has been cut down.🔽The sun of death has been crushed.

analyzed: vidhūtaḥ vidyā andhakāraḥ
translated: The darkness of ignorance has been dispelled.

analyzed: prasāditāḥ anya tīrthyāḥ
translated: Other tīrthikas have been satisfied.

analyzed: saṃśoṣitāḥ catvāraḥ oghāḥ
translated: The four floods have been dried up.

analyzed: prajvālitāni dharma ulkāni
translated: The flames of the Dharma have been ignited.

analyzed: darśitaḥ bodhi mārgaḥ  niyojitaḥ kṣānti sauratye
translated: The path to enlightenment has been shown.🔽Patience and gentleness have been enjoined.

analyzed: krīḍāpitaḥ dhyāna saukhye
translated: The bliss of meditation has been enjoyed.

analyzed: avabodhitāni cattvāri ārya satyāni
translated: The four noble truths have been realized.

original: samuttārito bhagavatā mahākāruṇikena śāstrā janmasamudrāt sadevako lokaḥ /
analyzed: samuttāritaḥ bhagavatā mahā kāruṇikena śāstrā janma samudrāt sa devakaḥ lokaḥ
translated: The world with its gods has been rescued from the ocean of rebirth by the Blessed One, the Greatly Compassionate Teacher.

analyzed: praveśitāḥ sattvāḥ abhayapuram
translated: Beings have been brought to the city of fearlessness.

original: atha te devamanuṣyā nānāpuṣpadhūpagandhamālyālaṃkāravibhūṣaṇairbhagavantamabhyarcayitvā bhagavato 'rthāya te mārgaṃ śobhayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: atha te deva manuṣyāḥ nānā puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya alaṃkāra vibhūṣaṇaiḥ bhagavantam abhyarcayitvā bhagavataḥ rthāya te mārgam śobhayāmāsuḥ
translated: Then those gods and humans, having worshipped the Blessed One with various flowers, incense, garlands, and ornaments, adorned the path for the sake of the Blessed One.

analyzed: divya vastra puṣpa duṣyaiḥ ca bhagavantam saṃcchādayanti sma
translated: They covered the Blessed One with divine garments and flowers.

analyzed: divyaiḥ ca māndārava māhāmāndārava pārūṣaka mahāpārūṣaka mañjūṣaka roca mahāroca utpala kumuda puṇḍarīkaiḥ saṃcchādayāmāsuḥ
translated: They covered him with divine coral tree flowers, great coral tree flowers, spider lily flowers, great spider lily flowers, royal jasmine flowers, great royal jasmine flowers, blue lotuses, white lotuses, and red lotuses.

original: yatra bhagavān tau caraṇau niścikṣepa tasmiṃśca mārge ubhayoḥ pārśvayoḥ divyān saptaratnamayān vṛkṣān abhinirmīya divyavastraduṣyahastakarṇaśīrṣābharaṇairalaṃcakruḥ
analyzed: yatra bhagavān tau caraṇau niścikṣepa tasmin ca mārge ubhayoḥ pārśvayoḥ divyān sapta ratna mayān vṛkṣān abhinirmīya divya vastra duṣya hasta karṇa śīrṣa ābharaṇaiḥ alaṃcakruḥ
translated: Wherever the Blessed One placed his feet on that path, on both sides he manifested divine trees made of the seven precious substances, and adorned them with divine garments, silk, hand ornaments, earrings, and head ornaments.

original: teṣu ca vṛkṣāntareṣu divyāṃ puṣkariṇīṃ māpayanti sma /
analyzed: teṣu ca vṛkṣa antareṣu divyām puṣkariṇīm māpayanti sma
translated: Between those trees they created divine lotus ponds.

analyzed: śīta svādu udaka viprasannā anāvilā aṣṭāṅga upeta vāri paripūrṇā samantāt sapta ratna alaṃkāra alaṃkṛtā
translated: filled with water that was cool, sweet, clear, and unsullied, possessing eight qualities, and adorned all around with the seven precious substances.

original: antarikṣe ca saptaratnamayāni cchatrāṇi dadhire /🔽dhvajapatākāsuvarṇasūtramuktāhārāṃśca suvarṇacūrṇavarṣāśca vavarṣuḥ /
analyzed: antarikṣe ca sapta ratna mayāni chatrāṇi dadhire  dhvaja patākā suvarṇa sūtra muktā hārān ca suvarṇa cūrṇa varṣāḥ ca vavarṣuḥ
translated: In the sky, they held up parasols made of the seven precious substances.🔽They rained down banners, flags, golden threads, pearl necklaces, and golden dust.

analyzed: rūpya vaiḍūrya cūrṇa agaru tagara candana kāla anusāri tamāla patra varṣāṇi samutsasarjuḥ
translated: They released a rain of silver, lapis lazuli, agaru, tagara, sandalwood, black agarwood, and tamala leaf powder.

analyzed: gośīrṣa uraga sāra candana cūrṇam
translated: They rained down gośīrṣa and uragasāra sandalwood powder.

analyzed: ca tasmin mārge vavarṣuḥ
translated: They rained down on that road.

analyzed: suvarṇa sūtra muktā hāra maṇi muktābhiḥ ca sarvam gagana talam nānā divya alaṃkāraiḥ alañcakruḥ
translated: They adorned the entire sky with golden threads, pearl necklaces, jewels, pearls, and various divine ornaments.

original: tatastasya nagarasya ca bahirdhā devamanuṣyā bhagavataḥ pūjākarmaṇe mārgaśobhāṃ cakrire /
analyzed: tatas tasya nagarasya ca bahirdhā deva manuṣyāḥ bhagavataḥ pūjā karmaṇe mārga śobhām cakrire
translated: Then, outside that city, gods and humans made preparations to adorn the road for the worship of the Blessed One.

original: antarnagara ca mārā mārapārṣadaśca śobhāvyūhairvyūhamāyāsurbhagavataḥ pūjākarmaṇe /
analyzed: antar nagara ca mārāḥ māra pārṣadaḥ ca śobhā vyūhaiḥ vyūham āyāsuḥ bhagavataḥ pūjā karmaṇe
translated: And inside the city, Māra and his retinue made preparations with various adornments for the worship of the Blessed One.

original: atha khalu bhagavān tasmin samaye śūraṃgamaṃ nāma samādhiṃ samāpede /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasmin samaye śūraṃgamam nāma samādhim samāpede
translated: Then, at that time, the Blessed One entered the samādhi called Heroic Progress.

original: tena ca samādhinā yathā samāpanna eva mārgaṃ jagāma /
analyzed: tena ca samādhinā yathā samāpannaḥ eva mārgam jagāma
translated: And by that concentration, he went on the path as if he had entered it.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena nānāvidhaiḥ kāyarūpaliṅgeryāpathairbhagavāṃstaṃ mārgamabhipratasthe /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena nānāvidhaiḥ kāya rūpa liṅga īryāpathaiḥ bhagavān tam mārgam abhipratasthe
translated: At that time, the Blessed One went on that path with various kinds of bodily forms, characteristics, and deportments.

original: tatra ye sattvā brahmabhaktikā brahmavainayikāste brahmarūpeṇa bhagavantaṃ mārgaṃ vrajantamadrākṣuḥ /
analyzed: tatra ye sattvāḥ brahmabhaktikāḥ brahma vainayikāḥ te brahma rūpeṇa bhagavantam mārgam vrajantam adrākṣuḥ
translated: There, those beings who were devoted to Brahma and were to be guided by Brahma saw the Blessed One going on the path in the form of Brahma.

original: yāvad ye śakravainayikā ye nārāyaṇavainayikā ye maheśvaravainayikā ye cāturmahārājavainayikā
analyzed: yāvat ye śakra vainayikāḥ ye nārāyaṇa vainayikāḥ ye maheśvara vainayikāḥ ye cāturmahārāja vainayikā
translated: Up to those who were to be guided by Shakra, those who were to be guided by Narayana, those who were to be guided by Mahesvara, those who were to be guided by the Four Great Kings,

original: ye cakravartivainayikā ye koṭṭarājavainayikā ye maharṣivainayikā ye śramaṇavainayikā

analyzed: kliṣṭeṣu pañca kaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu kṣaṇāt sannipatya sattva hita artham dhāraṇī mantra padāni bhāṣiṣyante
translated: having instantly assembled in the defiled buddha-fields with the five impurities, will speak these dhāraṇī-mantra words for the benefit of beings,

analyzed: imām ca dharmanetrīm adhiṣṭhāsyanti
translated: and will consecrate this Dharma method.

original: sarveṣāṃ śaktrabrahmalokapālānāṃ haste imāṃ dharmanetrīmanuparindāsyanti rakṣāparipālanārtham /
analyzed: sarveṣām śaktra brahma lokapālānām haste imām dharmanetrīm anuparindāsyanti rakṣā paripālana artham
translated: They will entrust this Dharma method to the hands of all the Śakras, Brahmās, Lokapālas, and world guardians for the sake of protection and preservation.

analyzed: vayam api etarhi yuṣmākam iha buddhakṣetra nivāsinām cāturdvīpika nivāsinām ca śakra brahmā lokapāla deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga indrāṇām
translated: We now entrust this [Dharma] to the hands of you who dwell in this Buddha-field, and to the Śakras, Brahmās, Lokapālas, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas who dwell in the four continents,

analyzed: haste bhūyiṣṭhataram anuparindāmaḥ ārakṣāyai sattva paripāka artham
translated: for the sake of protecting and ripening beings.

original: tathā yuṣmābhiriyaṃ saddharmanetrī manasi kartavyā projjvālayitavyā yathā na kṣiprameva pralujyeta nāntardhīyeta /
analyzed: tathā yuṣmābhiḥ iyam saddharma netrī manasi kartavyā projjvālayitavyā yathā na kṣipram eva pralujyeta na antardhīyeta
translated: In the same way, you should keep this Dharma method in mind and make it flourish, so that it does not quickly disappear and vanish.

original: ye ca śrāddhāḥ kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraśca saddharmadhārakāśca pudgalā bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikā
analyzed: ye ca śrāddhāḥ kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca saddharma dhārakāḥ ca pudgalāḥ bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikā
translated: And those faithful sons and daughters of good family, and those individuals who uphold the true Dharma, the monks, nuns, laymen and laywomen,

original: ye imaṃ mahāsannipātaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ dhārayanti yāvat pustakalikhitamapi kṛtvā dhārayanti
analyzed: ye imam mahā sannipātam dharmaparyāyam dhārayanti yāvat pustaka likhitam api kṛtvā dhārayanti
translated: who uphold this Dharma discourse of the Great Assembly, up to those who uphold it by writing it down in a book,

original: dharmabhāṇakā dharmaśrāvaṇikā dhyānayuktāḥ saddharmadhārakā yuṣmābhiste rakṣitavyāḥ pūjayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: dharma bhāṇakāḥ dharma śrāvaṇikāḥ dhyāna yuktāḥ saddharma dhārakāḥ yuṣmābhiḥ te rakṣitavyāḥ pūjayitavyāḥ
translated: You should protect and honor those Dharma teachers and Dharma students who are devoted to meditation and uphold the true Dharma.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: sarvabuddhādhiṣṭhito 'yaṃ dharmaparyāyo Dutt 🔽yatra kvacid grāme vā nagare vā nigame vā janapade vā karvaṭe vā rājakule vāraṇyāyatane🔽vā yāvat kuṭumbikagṛhe vāyaṃ dharmaparyāyaḥ pracaret prakāśyeta uddiśyeta paryavāpyeta
analyzed: sarva buddha dhiṣṭhitaḥ yam dharmaparyāyaḥ  yatra kvacid grāme vā nagare vā nigame vā janapade vā karvaṭe vā rāja kule vā araṇi āyatane  vā yāvat kuṭumbika gṛhe vā ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ pracaret prakāśyeta uddiśyeta paryavāpyeta
translated: This Dharma discourse is blessed by all the Buddhas.🔽Wherever this Dharma discourse is practiced, taught, recited,

original: vā antaśaḥ pustakalikhitamapi kṛtvā bhāṣyeta tena dharmarasena pṛthivīrasasattvaujāṃsi vivardhiṣyante /
analyzed: vā antaśas pustaka likhitam api kṛtvā bhāṣyeta tena dharma rasena pṛthivī rasa sattva ojāṃsi vivardhiṣyante
translated: or even just written down in the form of a book and kept, by the nectar of the Dharma, the vital essence of the earth, beings, and plants will increase.

analyzed: tena yūyam ojovantaḥ tejaḥ bala vīrya parākramavantaḥ bhaviṣyatha
translated: Through that, you will become full of vitality, with splendor, strength, energy, and valor.

analyzed: parivāra vimāna vṛddhiḥ ca yuṣmākam bhaviṣyati
translated: You will have an increase in retinue and glory.

analyzed: manuṣya rājāḥ api ārakṣitāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Even human kings will be protected.

original: rājaiśvaryeṇa te vivardhiṣyante sarvarāṣṭraṃ ca teṣāṃ surakṣitaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: rāja aiśvaryeṇa te vivardhiṣyante sarva rāṣṭram ca teṣām su rakṣitam bhaviṣyati
translated: They will increase in royal power and their entire kingdom will be well-protected.

original: tena ca dharmarasena santarpitā jambudvīpe rājānaḥ parasparahitacittā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tena ca dharma rasena santarpitāḥ jambudvīpe rājānaḥ paraspara hita cittāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: And the kings of Jambudvīpa, satisfied by that taste of the Dharma, will have thoughts of mutual benefit.

analyzed: karma vipākam śraddhāsyanti
translated: They will have faith in the ripening of karma.

analyzed: kuśala cittāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will have wholesome thoughts.

original: amatsaracittā hitavastucittāḥ sarvasattvadayācittā yāvat samyagdṛṣṭikā rājāno bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: amatsara cittāḥ hita vastu cittāḥ sarva sattva dayā cittāḥ yāvat samyak dṛṣṭikāḥ rājānaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will have thoughts free from stinginess, thoughts of beneficial things, thoughts of compassion for all beings, up to having right views.

analyzed: prati prati sva viṣaye bhiraṃsyante
translated: They will each delight in their own kingdoms.

original: ayaṃ ca jambudvīpaḥ sphīta udāro janākīrṇo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ayam ca jambudvīpaḥ sphītaḥ udāraḥ jana ākīrṇaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And this Jambudvīpa will be prosperous, vast, and populous.

analyzed: subhīkṣataraḥ ramaṇīyataraḥ ca bhaviṣyati
translated: It will be very well-supplied with food and more delightful.

original: bahujanamanuṣyākīrṇā ojovatī ca pṛthivī bhaviṣyati snigdhatarā ca /
analyzed: bahu jana manuṣya ākīrṇā ojovatī ca pṛthivī bhaviṣyati snigdhatarā ca
translated: The earth will be full of many people and men, and will be full of vitality and even more moist.

analyzed: mṛdutara phalāni ca
translated: The fruits will be softer.

analyzed: yatra oṣadhi dhana dhānya samṛddhatarā ca ārogya sukha sparśa vihāra saṃjananī ca bhaviṣyati
translated: It will be full of medicinal herbs, wealth, and grain, and will generate the experience of the happiness of good health.

analyzed: sarva kali kalaha durbhikṣa roga para cakra daṃśa maśaka śalabha āśi viṣa duṣṭa yakṣa rākṣasa mṛga pakṣi vṛkāḥ akāla vāta vṛṣṭayaḥ praśamiṣyanti
translated: All quarrels, fights, famines, diseases, invasions by foreign powers, mosquitoes, gadflies, locusts, poisonous snakes, evil yakṣas, rākṣasas, beasts, and birds, and untimely winds and rains will be pacified.

analyzed: samyak nakṣatra rātri divasa ardha māsa ṛtu saṃvatsarāṇi
translated: The constellations, nights, days, half-months, seasons, and years will be well-timed.

analyzed: pravahiṣyanti
translated: They will proclaim

analyzed: sattvāḥ ca prāyas daśa kuśala karma patha cāriṇaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: And beings will mostly practice the ten wholesome actions.

analyzed: itas cyutāḥ sugati svarga gāminaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Having passed away from here, they will go to the happy realms and the heavens.

analyzed: te pi yuṣmad parivārāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will also become your retinue.

original: evaṃ bahuguṇamahānuśaṃso 'yaṃ dhāraṇīdharmaparyāyaḥ sarvabuddhādhiṣṭhito mahāsaṃnipātaḥ sattvānāṃ saṃskārapāraṅgamāya yaśovivṛddhipāripūryai
analyzed: evam bahu guṇa mahā anuśaṃsaḥ yam dhāraṇī dharmaparyāyaḥ sarva buddha dhiṣṭhitaḥ mahā saṃnipātaḥ sattvānām saṃskāra pāraṅgamāya yaśaḥ vivṛddhi pāripūryai
translated: Thus, this dhāraṇī Dharma discourse has many virtues and great benefits. It is blessed by all the Buddhas, a great assembly, for beings to reach the other shore of conditioned existence, for the increase and fulfillment of fame,🔽and for the complete exhaustion of the state of being a woman.

analyzed: bhaviṣyati  niravaśeṣam mātṛgrāma bhāva parikṣayāya upapatti vedanīyaḥ para paryāya vedanīyaḥ saṃkṣepāt
translated: In brief,🔽that female body which is to be experienced in the next life or in subsequent lives,

original: dṛṣṭadharmavedanīyo 'pi sa mātṛgrāmātmabhāvaḥ ākṣiptaḥ sa sarvaḥ parikṣayaṃ yāsyati
analyzed: dṛṣṭa dharma vedanīyaḥ u pi sa mātṛgrāma ātmabhāvaḥ ākṣiptaḥ sa sarvaḥ parikṣayam yāsyati
translated: all of it will be completely exhausted,

analyzed: sthāpi ānantarya kāriṇam saddharma pratikṣepakam vā ārya apavādakam vā
translated: except for one who has committed the crimes with immediate retribution or rejected the true Dharma or reviled the noble ones.

original: yadanyat kāyavāṅmanaḥphalavipākadauṣṭhulyaṃ tat sarvaṃ parikṣayaṃ yāsyati /
analyzed: yat anyat kāya vāc manaḥ phala vipāka dauṣṭhulyam tat sarvam parikṣayam yāsyati
translated: All the other unwholesomeness of body, speech, and mind, the results of which are to be experienced in the hells, will be completely exhausted.

original: ya imaṃ dharmaparyāyam antaśaḥ pustakalikhitamapi kṛtvā dhārayiṣyati tasya sumerumātrāṇi karmakleśavaraṇāni parikṣayaṃ yāsyanti /
analyzed: yaḥ imam dharmaparyāyam antaśas pustaka likhitam api kṛtvā dhārayiṣyati tasya sumeru mātrāṇi karma kleśa varaṇāni parikṣayam yāsyanti
translated: Whoever, having written out this Dharma discourse in book form, would preserve it, their karmic afflictions and obscurations, as great as Mount Sumeru, will be completely exhausted.

analyzed: sarva kuśala mūla ālambanāni ca vivṛddhim pāripūrim yāsyanti
translated: And all the bases of wholesome actions will increase and be fulfilled.

original: sarvāṅgapāripūriḥ sarvābhiprāyasaṃpattiḥ sarvāṇi kāyavāṅmanaḥsucaritāni ca vivardhiṣyante /
analyzed: sarva aṅga pāripūriḥ sarva abhiprāya saṃpattiḥ sarvāṇi kāya vāc manaḥ su caritāni ca vivardhiṣyante
translated: All the limbs will be complete, all intentions will be accomplished, and all the good actions of body, speech, and mind will increase.

analyzed: sarva kudṛṣṭi prahāṇam sarva śatruḥ saha dharma nigrahaḥ sarva sūkṣma śānta mārga avatāraḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: All bad views will be abandoned, all enemies will be subdued through the Dharma, and all will enter the subtle path of peace.

original: asya sarvabuddhādhiṣṭhitasya mahāsaṃnipātadhāraṇīdharmaparyāyasya prabhāveṇa yatra ca viṣaye punarayaṃ dharmaparyāyaḥ pracariṣyati tatra sā 🔽pṛthivī snigdhatarā bhaviṣyati /🔽ojovatī mṛduphalarasā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: asya sarva buddha adhiṣṭhitasya mahā saṃnipāta dhāraṇī dharmaparyāyasya prabhāveṇa yatra ca viṣaye punar ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ pracariṣyati tatra sā  pṛthivī snigdhatarā bhaviṣyati  ojovatī mṛdu phala rasā bhaviṣyati
translated: By the power of this great assembly dhāraṇī Dharma discourse, which is blessed by all the Buddhas, wherever this Dharma discourse is practiced, there🔽the earth will become more moist.🔽It will be full of vitality and have soft and tasty fruits.

analyzed: tikta kaṭuka paruṣa virasa parivarjitā bhaviṣyati
translated: It will be free from bitter, pungent, rough, and tasteless things.

analyzed: puṣpa phala samṛddhatarā dhana dhānya koṣa koṣṭhāgāra kumbha kalaśa vṛddhiḥ bhaviṣyati vastra anna pāna auṣadha upakaraṇā bhūyiṣṭhatarā
translated: There will be an abundance of flowers and fruits, an increase in wealth, grain, treasuries, storehouses, jars, and vases, and an abundance of clothing, food, drink, medicine, and utensils.

original: ye ca tatra annapānopajīvitasattvāste nīrogatarā bhaviṣyanti varṇavanto balavantaḥ smṛtimantaḥ prajñāvanto dharmakāmāḥ kuśalaparyeṣṭyabhiratāḥ
analyzed: ye ca tatra anna pāna upajīvita sattvāḥ te nīrogatarāḥ bhaviṣyanti varṇavantaḥ balavantaḥ smṛtimantaḥ prajñāvantaḥ dharma kāmāḥ kuśala paryeṣṭi abhiratāḥ  /
translated: Those beings who depend on food and drink there will be healthier, more beautiful, stronger, more mindful, wiser, desirous of the Dharma, and devoted to seeking virtue.

analyzed: pāpa parivarjitāḥ
translated: They will be free from evil.

analyzed: te tatas cyavitvā yuṣmākam sahabhāvyatāya upapatsyante
translated: Having passed away from there, they will be reborn in your company.

original: tathā yūyaṃ parivāravṛddhā balavanto 'pratihatacakrā dharmabalena cāturvarṇyaṃ janakāyaṃ paripālayiṣyatha /
analyzed: tathā yūyam parivāra vṛddhāḥ balavantaḥ pratihata cakrāḥ dharma balena cāturvarṇyam jana kāyam paripālayiṣyatha
translated: Thus, you will be increased in retinue, strong, with an invincible wheel, and will protect the people of the four castes with the power of the Dharma.

analyzed: sattvān dharma artheṣu niyokṣyatha
translated: You will engage beings in the affairs of Dharma.

original: evaṃ yuṣmābhiḥ sarvatryadhvānugatānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: evam yuṣmābhiḥ sarva tri adhva anugatānām buddhānām bhagavatām pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati
translated: Thus, you will have made offerings to the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who follow in all three times.

analyzed: atha khalu māndāravagandharocaḥ tathāgataḥ viśuddhena buddha viṣaya jñāna svara ghoṣeṇa artha pada vyāhāra anurūpeṇa
translated: Then the Tathāgata Mandāravagandharoca, with a pure voice of knowledge of the domain of the Buddha, in a voice that accords with the expression of meaning and words,

original: kṛtsnamidaṃ buddhakṣetramāpūrya sarve ca bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ śakrendrā yāvad
analyzed: kṛtsnam idam buddhakṣetram āpūrya sarve ca bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ śakra indrāḥ yāvat
translated: All the Bodhisattva Mahasattvas, Sakra Indras, up to the Brahmakayika gods, the Four Kings, and the world with its gods, humans, asuras, Garudas, Gandharvas, and Maha nagas, all of them, having assembled, said to the Blessed One:

original: brahmendrā mahoragendrā ye ceha buddhakṣetre nivāsino bhūyiṣṭhataram asyāṃ cāturdvīpikāyāṃ🔽nivāsinaḥ sarvabuddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ ca vacanena cāsya saṃnipātasūtrasya dharmanetrayā
analyzed: brahma indrāḥ mahoraga indrāḥ ye ca iha buddhakṣetre nivāsinaḥ bhūyiṣṭhataram asyām cāturdvīpikāyām  nivāsinaḥ sarva buddhānām bhagavatām ca vacanena ca asya saṃnipāta sūtrasya dharma netrayā
translated: Having filled this entire Buddha-field, all the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas, the Sakra Indras, up to the Brahma Indras, the great serpent lords, and those who dwell in this Buddha-field, mostly dwelling in this four-continent world-system,🔽by the words of all the Blessed Buddhas, they encouraged the assembly for the sake of upholding, teaching, and protecting this Dharma method of the Sutra of the Assembly,

analyzed: dhāraṇāya prakāśanāya rakṣaṇāya utsāhayāmāsa
translated: this Dharma discourse.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena maitreyapūrvaṅgamāṇāṃ saptanavatikoṭīsahasrāṇi kṣāntipratilabdhānāṃ mahāsattvānāmiha buddhakṣetre nivāsīni tāni sarvāṇi
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena maitreyapūrvaṅgamāṇām saptanavati koṭī sahasrāṇi kṣānti pratilabdhānām mahāsattvānām iha buddhakṣetre nivāsīni tāni sarvāṇi
translated: Then, at that time, the seventy-nine hundred thousand koti Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas who had attained patience, led by Maitreya, who dwelt in this Buddha-field, all

analyzed: eka kaṇṭhena evam āhuḥ
translated: with one voice said this:

original: vayamapi sarvabuddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ vacanena sarvatryadhvānugatānāṃ tathāgatānāṃ Dutt
analyzed: vayam api sarva buddhānām bhagavatām vacanena sarva tri adhva anugatānām tathāgatānām
translated: We also, by the words of all the Blessed Buddhas, of all the Tathagatas who have gone in the three times, for the sake of worshipping the Dharma,

original: pūjārthamimaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ nyāyataḥ śāstrasaṃmatato gurugauraveṇa pratigṛṇhīmaḥ /
analyzed: pūjā artham imam dharmaparyāyam nyāyataḥ śāstra saṃmatataḥ guru gauraveṇa pratigṛṇhīmaḥ
translated: we respectfully accept this Dharma discourse with proper reasoning and scriptural approval, with reverence for the teacher.

original: kāruṇyena sattvaparipākārthaṃ yāvadanuttare mārge pratiṣṭhāpanārthaṃ vayamimaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ grāmanagaranigamajanapadarājadhānyaraṇyāyataneṣu 🔽vistareṇa uddayotayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: kāruṇyena sattva paripāka artham yāvat anuttare mārge pratiṣṭhāpana artham vayam imam dharmaparyāyam grāma nagara nigama janapada rājadhānī araṇya āyataneṣu  vistareṇa uddayotayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: Out of compassion, for the sake of ripening beings, up to establishing them in the unsurpassed path, we will extensively illuminate this Dharma discourse in villages, towns, cities, countries, capitals, and forests,

analyzed: sattvān ca paripācayiṣyāmaḥ saddharma cira sthiti artham
translated: in order to ripen beings and ensure the longevity of the true Dharma.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena sarve buddhā bhagavantastabduddhakṣetrāntargatāḥ sādhukāraṃ pradaduḥ /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena sarve buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tad duddhakṣetra antargatāḥ sādhukāram pradaduḥ
translated: Then at that time, all the Blessed Buddhas who had entered that Buddha-field gave their approval:

original: sādhu sādhu satpuruṣā evaṃ yuṣmābhiḥ karaṇīyam /
analyzed: sādhu sādhu sat puruṣāḥ evam yuṣmābhiḥ karaṇīyam
translated: Excellent, excellent, O good men! You should do just as you have said.

original: atha khalu sarve śakrabrahmamahoragendrā ye ceha buddhakṣetre aparāṇī catuḥṣaṣṭikoṭīnayutāni mahaujaskamahaujaskānāṃ sattvānāṃ te sarve ekakaṇṭhenaivamāhuḥ
analyzed: atha khalu sarve śakra brahma mahā uraga indrāḥ ye ca iha buddhakṣetre aparāṇī catuḥṣaṣṭi koṭī nayutāni mahā ojaska mahā ojaskānām sattvānām te sarve eka kaṇṭhena evam āhuḥ
translated: Then all the Śakras, Brahmās, and great serpent lords, and the other 6,400,000,000,000 powerful beings in this Buddha-field, all with one voice said:

analyzed: vayam api etam mahā sannipātam dharmaparyāyam udgrahīṣyāmaḥ
translated: We too will uphold this Dharma discourse of the Great Assembly,

original: yāvad vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyāmaḥ samuddayotayiṣyāmaḥ sattvāṃśca paripācayiṣyāmaḥ saddharmacirasthityartham /
analyzed: yāvat vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyāmaḥ samuddayotayiṣyāmaḥ sattvān ca paripācayiṣyāmaḥ saddharma cira sthiti artham
translated: and we will extensively teach it, illuminate it, and ripen beings in order to ensure the longevity of the true Dharma.

analyzed: saddharma dhārakān dharma śrāvaṇikān ca rakṣiṣyāmaḥ paripālayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will protect and guard those who uphold the true Dharma and those who listen to the Dharma.

original: yatra cāyaṃ dharmaparyāyaḥ pracariṣyāti tatra vayaṃ sarvabuddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ vacanena
analyzed: yatra ca ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ pracariṣyāti tatra vayam sarva buddhānām bhagavatām vacanena
translated: And wherever this Dharma discourse will be practiced, there, by the word of all the Blessed Buddhas,

analyzed: sarva kali kalaha vigraha vivāda durbhikṣa roga para cakra akāla vāta vṛṣṭi śīta uṣṇāni ca duṣṭa rūkṣa paruṣa virasa tikta kaṭuka bhāvān praśamayiṣyāmaḥ
